  9. Even after reading all the reviews I was VERY skeptical and thought I would be returning. NO WAY could you pry this out of my hands at this point. Took some getting used to and it does take a long time because I have a lot of hair, its thick, and its long. So took prob 45 minutes to do all my hair but it stayed almost perfect for 3 days and by day 5 looked like beachy waves. I have very dry hair so I only wash every 3-5 days. Now when I curl it using this, I can go about 5 days. Miracle! SO happy I bought it and will likely be giving for presents this year.

A few that could be better are; 1) taking more hair - it only takes a small amount of hair and 2) an option to make curl bigger (it's my preference since I don't want too curly). But I have to say, it's worth the money!

  16. Works like a charm. You need a bit of practice but after my first try I got the hang of it.
  17. I love this curling device! I have extremely thick hair and it took a very long time but the results were awesome and I received compliments from total strangers! On the downside, I must admit, it is a little bit scary when your hair gets tangled so please follow the instructions carefully and only attempt to do very small sections of your hair at a time, trust me, the results are worth it! A method that worked well for me, but which also took time, was to twist my hair up tightly in each section about 2 inches from the root and using the twisted section to place inside the open device and then clamping it closed. I think that this method allowed the curler to have ample space to evenly wrap the strands of hair and prevented tangles.placing sections that are too thick or having stray pieces of hair that falls outside the boundaries of the curler cause very scary tangles that are very difficult to remove from the hot iron without breaking off. Also, since my hair is very thick and very long, I left it in the closed iron for about 20 seconds, anything less provided a loose, inconsistent curl. I can't tolerate not washing my hair but I decided to use dry shampoo on my hair the next day so the curls lasted two days without any hairspray or additional product.If you use this device properly you will not be disappointed!
  18. Very easy to use! I was skeptical but it really does work! Loved it!

  34. The Curl Secret is the first &#34;miracle&#34; tool I've used that actually lived up to the hype. After carefully reading the reviews (Pros: It's life-changing!, Cons: Your hair will be torn out in flaming chunks) I decided to give it try. I have fine, straight hair that falls to around my shoulder blades, and it has been my mother's lifetime grievance that it refuses to hold a curl - not even when threatened with copious amounts of hairspray, mousse, or gel.<br /><br />I have included pictures of the first time I used the Curl Secret. The curls stayed all day with no hairspray or any other product.I love the volume and texture I get with the Curl Secret, and I have received many compliments on my hair since I started using it.I will say that you MUST FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS. The Curl Secret will not abide more than 1inch of hair in the feeder, nor will it accept hair that is not brushed. You WILL experience some tangling with the Curl Secret, but don't panic, if you have brushed the hair beforehand it should slide without any issue. For this reason I wouldn't recommend using this tool for younger girls since they might not handle this type of tangle well.<br />My overall verdict is to follow the directions and enjoy some miraculous results!
  35. A huge hit! After giving to one daughter for Christmas, and then her demonstrating/trying it out on other females at the gathering they all wanted one! I would have a great idea for next Christmas but I'm sure they won't wait that long to get one. Wonderful product that works great.
  36. Amazing product...works well
  37. I was kind of nervous at first thinking this thing would pull my hair up into it as it curled, but this thing was amazing. I did my whole head in about 10 minutes with beautiful curls.Never one did the thing pull my hair or pull out strands. I'm a busy mom and this thing just gave me style again for the first time in years. very easy to use and makes great curls!!!
  38. I loved this product. I asked for one for Christmas this year and I read lots of reviews beforehand. I had no trouble figuring it out right away. My hair is medium length and thick. Only slight thing is you must do 1 inch pieces. But worth it. I did feel my hair start to tangle once but I opened the chamber and it dropped my hair immediately. My curls stayed over 24 hours with no product. I love this. Great for moms on the go!!
  39. This is one of my favorite purchases of 2014. However, it is extreeeeeeemely important to follow the instructions. If you make sure that all of your hair is seated down in the groove of the curler, then you will have perfect curls every time. When I would get in a hurry or put too much hair in there, then it would birdsnest every time. Only use if you have the time to do it. Rushing through is the perfect recipe for a mess!

  41. This was a gift for my teenage daughter. She loves it!
  42. I googled and googled and couldn't find a review of the Curl Secret of anyone with my hair type. So I decided to give it a shot myself. This is for anyone who walks into a hair salon with an explanation that typically starts off with &#34;It's complicated,&#34; before you even bother to sit in the stylist's chair and waste their time and yours. (And your money.)<br /><br />Allow me to explain. My hair is long, super thick, and naturally curly. It's GIGANTIC when I go natural. Enormous and difficult to manage on a daily basis. So I usually wear it straight with a slight curl. I use a Babyliss Pro Nano Titanium set on 40 to straighten it and a Hot Tools curler with a marcel grip to curl. (Yes, it takes forever.)<br /><br />When I saw the Curl Secret, I laughed to myself and rolled my eyes in contempt. Nice product. If your hair is not like mine. I wanted to give Miracurl a try, but I'm not dropping $300 plus on something that may or may not work. I received the Curl Secret as a gift. I didn't buy it because I figured it wouldn't get hot enough, blah, blah, blah. (I assumed it was your average piece of hair garbage.) Tried it for the first time today.<br /><br />And I'm stunned that it worked as well as it did. Could it be hotter and use a few extra seconds for my hair? Sure. But overall, I was incredibly impressed. And that is extremely rare when it comes to any hair product. I ABHOR selfies. (Props to those who have mastered the art of selfie.) But no one was around to take before/after photos. So yeah. Curl Secret. I'm shocked. Pleasantly I might add. Took a while to get the hang of it. But it may be worth it once I get the process down. Hope this helped anyone whose hair story usually begins with, &#34;It's complicated.&#34;
  43. So easy to use! Love the curls it puts in my hair! But have a hard time doing the back part of my head!
  44. was a present for my granddaughter, she loved it
  45. This is the golden gem of hair tools!! I have fairly long thick hair. Curling my hair used to take about 2 hours and I wasn't pleased with the result. This curling iron takes only 45 minutes and looks great. The heat is perfect and can give those tight or big curls. It really is several steps above the rest and totally worth the price!
  46. The parts that are too high to curl usually end up pretty frizzy and once the curl is made, you obviously can't brush it. Still working on a way around this
  47. My daughters pooled their money and bought this contraption, I didn't join in because I wasn't going to be involved in spending that much for a hair curler especially when we already have enough hair curling machines to stock the appliance section of a beauty store. Well, they bought it and....I use it just as much as they do. Maybe more. We all have long to medium length hair, on the fine side. I definitely agree with other reviewers who say it takes awhile to get the hang of using this, but once you do it really does work well. If the hair is sectioned up and small sections curled at a time just about anyone can achieve a full head of massive curls. If someone is looking for a more relaxed tousled look, that can be achieved too. Either way it's helpful to section off the hair. Hairy that's flying around with a lot of static might make this a bit harder to use, so on the days my hair has extra static I try and get that under control with a little bit of water first.<br /><br />Despite doing most of the work, this curler isn't really a &#34;time saver&#34;. The hair still has to be sectioned off and curled, however because the curler times each curl what this curler does do is take the guess work out of the whole process. This curler also eliminates the &#34;twist and hold&#34; action other curlers require and that alone is a benefit.<br /><br />Some main points:<br />- This curler can be downright scary the first time using it. It draws the hair into it very quickly - and if someone's natural reaction is to hold onto the end of the section of hair being curled, well that's when it's going to get stuck. So resist that natural reaction and let go of the end of the hair as soon as the curler is clamped onto the hair. Whoosh, the hair is drawn quickly in and curled. No tangles, no problems.<br />- The curler is clearly labeled as to which side should be facing the head.<br />- After the hair is drawn in the curler makes spaced apart short, high pitched &#34;beeps&#34;while the hair is being curled. Once the curl is done it switches to a series of &#34;beep beep beep beeps&#34; and that's the time to release the hair. Be sure to listen to these, the timing is perfect.<br />- IF hair becomes tangled in the curler, unplug it and ease out the tangled hair. Usually this has happened because the section being curled is too wide, or the end of the section of hair was being held onto too tightly when the curler was drawing the hair in.<br />- It's fairly heavy, something to consider for anyone who doesn't/can't hold up a fairly heavy hair curler.<br />- Because it's heavy, and gets hot, and spins, just as with any curling appliance it shouldn't be used by young kid. That seems to be obvious, but because this appliance looks so easy to use it might be tempting to hand it over to a young kid to use. Don't<br /><br />Overall this product does exactly what it's supposed to: curl the hair. Each curl is timed perfectly, and it does the work of rolling up the hair and timing the curl. The more we use it the more we like it. I gave it four stars because of the price - this is a pricey item. Even though it does a great job curling hair I'm still skeptical about the high price. It's the kind of product that in a couple years will be still selling well but at half the current price. Then again, at the rate these are being sold they just might keep the price high.
  48. This works amazing for the curling iron impaired, which I am. Yes my hair does get stuck in it sometimes but it is really no big deal. I could never accomplish this on my own with a traditional curling iron. I love it.
  49. This is a super neat product! I used it for the first time tonight, and of course I got my hair stuck in it, twice. For long hair, don't try to curl more than 1/2 inch at a time! The curl however is very nice, and using this was almost effortless!

  54. I have used all three products out there and this one is not too different from the baby bliss or instyler tulip, except with the Conair Infiniti you can only go one direction in curling your hair which is a real downside in comparison to its competition. I have had my hair caught in all three of them and I think its more user error, if you to stick to large of sections in it they will get tangled, and stuck and your hair will burn a bit. I do love the way the curls looks so I did keep going and as you keep doing it you learn the exact amount to put in your hair. I still find it hard to do the back of my hair and get it in right without it getting stuck. As far as price it can be found for the same price as the instyler tulip and I would choose the tulip over this one as you can see your hair in it and it gives you direction options for your curl and you can alternate the directions and the amount of curl you want. The babybliss works just as good as tulip but is much more expensive.<br /><br />You will get your hair stuck a few times with this curlers but relax and try smaller amounts. Defiantly take your time this isn't a quick hairstyler!
  55. You will love this product. It works!!! No more burns.
  56. Amazing! Buying one for my daughter!
  57. Like many others I have NEVER been able to curl my hair. I could use an entire bottle of hairspray and the curls would still fall out an hour later! Ugh. I had seen the commercial for the Curl Secret, as well as YouTube videos, and finally I saw a friend use one and that was it. I went to Walmart and bought it! I've only had it since yesterday but I've already curled my hair twice with it. The first time it took about 45 minutes to do my whole head. Doing the left side of my head was a little harder because of the way you need to orient the device. The second time I finally had the hang of it and curled my hair in about 30 minutes! Yes, my hair got tangled a few times but it was always my fault. I either had it too close to my head or put way too much hair into the chamber. The curls I did yesterday lasted ALL night. When I woke up in the morning it was still pretty wavy. I love this! Will recommend to all of my friends.<br />The only thing I wish they would fix would be to add a safety feature to open the barrel and remove hair when it gets stuck. I had a problem when I put a big chunk of hair in and it got stuck. No, I didn't have to cut my hair or anything but it took a few minutes to get it all out.
  58. DON'T BUY THIS IF YOU HAVE THICK HAIR. I bought this because it usually takes me about 30 minutes to curl my hair and I thought that his would cut that time in half. Instead I got my hair stuck in the barrel every time it went inside. So again, DON'T BUY THIS IF YOU HAVE THICK HAIR.
  59. I purchased this product for my 5 year old granddaughter....she used it a couple of times and worked great....after that it pulls her hair in and won't let go....I am very, very disappointed that Amazon will not take this product back as if I purchased it at Walmart, Target, etc, I would be able to a least get a credit to purchase something else. This is very disappointing for over $100 spent on this product.
  60. My 12 yr old grandaughter received this as a Christmas gift a year or two ago. She used it herself and her hair looked so great I bought one for myself. You separate a strand of hair, comb through it, then place the part of the strand closest to you head, not the end of the hair, into the slot of the device. The little hot roller inside the machine will roll your hair up into the round part of the device until the whole strand is inside. It then beeps at 3 different intervals so you can take it down at the same beep for consistant curls through out your hair. There are also different levels of heat. The longer you leave your hair in the device the tigher the curl. The sooner you take it down, the looser the curl. You can't get impatient and try to put too much hair in at one time. It will stop rolling the hair and beep to let you know something is wrong and your must start that strand again. I have long thick wavy hair and it takes me about 15 min to do my whole head. I use the highest heat, let each strand down after the first beep, let curls cool, then comb out my hair with only my fingers for the &#34;beach wave&#34; look. Or you can leave the hair in for all 3 beeps, don't comb or brush, and have long tigher curls. It's not really hard but does take some practice with the machine and practice to figure out what gives you the look you want. When I first started using it, I did get my hair tangled up inside the device. If this happens I turn the hair curler off and gently tug on my hair to unroll it out of the device. I have found that the times this has happened it was becaus I wasn't being careful, I was trying to rush, I was trying to put too much hair in, or I wasn't separating the sections of hair away from the rest of the hair allowing strays to roll up into the curler too. I love this thing and the curls would last 3 -4 days if I didn't have to wash my hair every other day. Sometimes on day 3, I can put a small amount of dry shampoo around my hairline andjust do a few touch up pieces of hair on the top. I also use a small amount of mousse or whatever I've got on hand to make styles last longer.
  61. Work fine and do the job.
  62. Bought this product Saturday, and it was a mistake. I've tried it multiple times with NO results. My hair is thin and it didn't even think about curling my hair. There was a limp curl that went flat immediately. I have to return it, and I would not recommend buying this product!!
  63. this curling iron is awesome! works awesome and hair doesn't stick in it at all!! very easy to use on yourself!

I wanted to try to do something fun with some all-over curls in my hair for some upcoming events this summer, and I have no patience for curlers or curling irons. So I thought I'd give these a try.<br />Within 10 minutes, I had adorable all-over-the-head curls. Easy, easy, easy. Pull a 1&#34; wide piece of hair straight out, put it in the machine, press the handle down, wait for the beeps, and presto! Gorgeous spirals. I saw that some other reviewers had a couple of easy-to-fix hair tangling issues, but it didn't happen to me. I believe it's because my hair is much shorter.<br />Quite frankly, this worked better than the $200 model and was half the price. I returned the other and kept this Conair Infiniti pro. I love it. Makes curling your hair non stressful!<br />I also think it is worth the $$$. Saves time and very very easy to use. It will make growing my hair in much easier to deal with!

  75. I really love this thing. I have very fine straight hair that never keeps a curl, and I've spend $$$ (esp. in the 80s) on perms and curling irons and rollers, and I never ever got what this thing can give me.<br />My hair is medium short in a bob, so the back, especially the lower back hairs are shorter, (three inches maybe?) so it doesn't work that great back there, but everywhere else..works great!<br />It is a little hard to do the back of my head by myself.   78. I'm a Cosmetologist, so naturally I was skeptical of this device. My husband bought it for me for Christmas and after reading the instructions several times and triple checking with online videos I felt that I was ready to give it a try. I put in the appropriate amount of hair and the first few curls were alright. Then horror struck. It sucked in a very important layer and it wouldn't come out; I had to sit there and watch my hair smoke and burn free! It was terrifying! I immediately threw my hair up in a bun after assessing the unfixable damage and returned it to the store immediately. Not only did that happen; it also breaks various prices during Curling. Who would want that?! In the past I have not found a single Conair item that has been decent for safe hair use- and I clearly still can't. It's safe to say that the device should be recalled for faulty safety precautions- it absolutely does not reverse so the hair can release resulting in severe damage.
  79. GREAT JUST BE CAREFUL HAIR DOES GET CAUGHT BURNS
  80. My hair got caught really easily and when it gets caught in a hot iron...it burns. Obviously. No good. Also, the handle was very difficult to push down for some reason.   91. This curling device was by far better then the more expensive product 'curl freak'. I borrowed my friends curl freak before and used it as a test run for buying this product and I got to say conair got this one right!! Conair's version is lighter so my hands don't tire easily and I had little to no problem with getting perfect curls every time. Some of the negative reviews on this product have me baffled because although yes hair can get stuck rarely this device immediately let's go for my and I have medium shoulder length, thick hair. I feel that maybe people with longer hair who tried to have this device curl from close to their scalp might have the issue with too much hair being pulled into the device. I would suggest for super long hair only using the device half way, so just from the middle down you have a nice curl.. Especially if your hair is long and thick. Also there is a certain way you have to hold this device with one special side facing your head, otherwise it does not curl at all.. But the words are printed on the device at what side needs to have your head so there shouldn't be too many forgetfulness moments. Overall this tool does it's job very nicely and again matches it's competitor perfectly

I used it Christmas eve and my cousin who is a hair dresser was shocked my hair looked so curly. It has several different settings (hi, med, low) and several different time incriments that it holds your hair in. I separated my hair up into sections with a hair clip. Did the under side of my hair first. It was very easy. The tool is a little weighty, but not too bad. My hair is a little longer then shoulder length and took about a half hour to do. I had a harder time in the back. I went over a bunch of areas a few times to fine tune it. Yes your hair does get stuck on occasion, but never stuck enough to not be able to get it out, or to damage it. I woke up Christmas day and still had a full look, just needed to run over it and tune it up. I also have EasiHair HD hair extensions that have lost their curl and I tried it real quick on one strand and it seemed like it didn't want to curl, but I was in a rush and just wanted to see what it would do. When I am ready to wear my extensions I will take some time to see what I can do with the Curl secret. This was just so easy and so cool.   104. I don't understand the fuss over this product. If you are seriously inept at doing hair, it might be worth the price. It by no means matches the quality of a high quality curling iron. I received the product and curled most of my hair without getting any stuck. It is easy to use, but at some point your hair will likely get tangled in the chamber. It happened to me twice, but I attribute that to user error. I'm not sure if I received a defective product, but mine smelled like burning plastic and constantly the red light would start blinking between curls (indicating it is not hot enough). It is also heavy and cumbersome to hold.<br /><br />My biggest issue with this product is the curl it creates. It can only accommodate small amounts of hair, and you cannot curl in the opposite direction (important to create dimension and avoid the &#34;triangle head&#34; look). Overall, the product feels cheap and I worry it damages hair. A high quality curling iron and some practice would be a much better investment.

  173. I too bought this even though some of the bad reviews had me concerned about hair getting stuck. My daughter has Down Syndrome and sensory wise hates curling irons. Her hair is fine and hard to hold a curl unless you put ALOT of product, and then it will last an hour tops. So I went on utube and watched the how to videos . This product is real simple to use and as people have said before, if you do it the right way you will not have problems. Only use an inch of hair at a time and make sure you are facing the open part of the curler to the head.always brush out each piece to make sure there are no snarls. We used no product and the curls held. My daughter loves the look! Having said that though I used the high settings and it only came out in a loose ringlet curl. For a tighter curl I would have to use less than an inch of hair. Everyone's hair is different so you just have to play with it until you find the right setting for you. I only gave it 4 stars because I felt the price is a little too high.

  193. Love the product! Had a little learning curve on which way to hold to have the barrel closest to head, but the curls last all day!!!
  194. I'm enjoying this new way of curling my hair! At first, I wasn't getting the results I saw in the TV ad but I read the directions again: when the timer goes off, I needed to open the curler all the way before pulling down - it made all the difference!<br /><br />Once you get the hang of holding the curler different ways in the mirror, it's simple to use. I recommend using a comb to create small sections of hair at first and then adding more hair until you figure out how wide the curler can handle - the safety sensor is a bit sensitive (which is good since it prevents tangled messes). I also found that if I use curling clips right after I make the curl and clip it up to my head while I finish curling the rest of my hair, the curls last longer. I usually do my makeup while the curls are pinned to let my hair cool into position.<br /><br />I have very fine hair and sometimes I have to use larger sections of hair in order to produce any amount of curl. I have shoulder-length hair but I wouldn't recommend this product for anyone with a shorter than shoulder-length hair style. You have to have long enough hair for the curler to feed the hair into the mechanism before it can produce any time of a curl - that's where it differs from using a tradition curling iron or curlers.<br /><br />I have very straight hair and have been curling my hair everyday for as long as I can remember. This is a fun way to get a different look and I've been using it about every other day since it got it about a month ago. I get a lot of compliments on the curls!<br /><br />The curler is definitely more expensive than the average curling iron or roller set but it works as advertised and produces a pretty look!
  195. so much easier than using a curling iron. I have long hair and my curls last all day!
  196. I still hate myself for this purchase. I have quite long straight hair & have used many different curling methods. I saw a YouTube & loved the quick looking tumbling waves that it made. The long story short, it's much more satisfying to watch the commercial than to do at home. My first attempt terrified me because I thought the curler would never dislodge from my head. The next four attempts had varying degrees of tangles stuck in the appliance. The motor would turn itself off, & you could try to reverse but mostly you need to pick out the rat's nest one strand at a time. The trick is to put a very small amount of hair (like a third of what they do in the commercial) & put hair strand in as parallel as possible. The quality of the curl once you get it right is good. The process is much longer than using a curling iron & it is VERY heavy. After the fifth time I used it, I got hair caught again & the motor gave out.
  197. Bought for the girlfriend for christmas, and her and her daughter both use it all the time. They love how quick it curls hair, just make sure you dont put it in backwards lol its funny
  198. This definitely does work. I was Skeptical just like everyone else. YOU NEED TO READ ALL THE INSTRUCTIONS before using it. I was so excited to try it I had just glanced over the instructions and started trying to use it, well I wasn't getting any results and was about to give up until I decided to look at the instructions one last time. I had been holding the iron on my hair until it beeped, I thought the beep meant it was done, Nope! You hold it for 5 beeps if you want more defined curls. I tried one more time, this time hold it for 5 beeps and perfect curl! You also have to make sure your hair is brushed PERFECTLY if its not separated and brushed neat it will eat your hair. My hair came out of it pretty easy but I did panic for a second lol. All in all I think this product is great and does what it claims if you take time to read how to use it correctly. It takes a minute to get used to it but once you do you have perfect curls quickly. I gave 4 stars bc I think 100+ dollars for any hair thing is crazy! Mine was a gift, tooooo much money, but great product :)

  203. Bought this curler last summer and have had no issues with it, works like a charm.   204. Fun easy to use great product for curling your hair. It takes a bit of time to get used to how to hold it, how much hair to put in at one time, etc but once you get that down (be a bit patient with yourself), you'll love it. It can give you a tight curl which you can leave &#34;as is&#34; or you can brush that tight curl out and just give you full waves. It you want a flip or some sort-of &#34;traditional&#34; curl look then this is not the gadget. Stick with curlers, hot rollers, curling iron... but, if you want fun wavy curls that add bounce, this is it.

  208. I have fairly long, think hair to the middle of my back. Make sure to use small sections of hair, If it stops winding hair in and beeps, don't pull it right out of your hair. Wait a second and the machine unwinds your hair, and then remove it and start over with a smaller section. If I just curl the bottom 6 inches I can be done in under 10 minutes. The curls last ALL day. My hair usually doesn't hold a curl so this is working out great for me. I don't even have to use hair spray.

By the way, no offense to Amazon but I found this curler way cheaper at my local drug store and big box store. Anyway, this iron is awesome...perfect curls every single time as promised. There is a bit of a learning curve in regards to figuring out the amount of hair you can fit in and trying to maneuver the iron at the back of your head. But once you figure that out you're golden.   212. I have been only TOO EAGER to write my review since my Curl Secret arrived on Mother's Day (thank you, Amazon Prime!).<br /><br />Okay first - before I made my purchase on Amazon.com I did my research. I watched numerous YouTube videos and read reviews... so by the time my product arrived, I used it flawlessly on the first go! It was so fun and easy to use!! So do your due diligence and take about 10-15 minutes to watch other users work this curling device so you know what you're doing. It's funny to watch the folks who didn't follow the instructions too, but hey, this will help you know what NOT to do ;-)<br /><br />Some tips:<br />1. Use &#34;day two&#34; hair, meaning, don't use on freshly washed and dried hair. That'll just add to your morning routine. For me, working with day two hair means I still have some thermal protector spray and product in from the day before. I have medium-long hair, colored & highlighted hair, with the thickness fine to medium. I can curl my entire head in less than 15 minutes. Sometimes even in 10 minutes. This product is revolutionary and if you do it right, it will provide you with curls that will have folks in the office asking &#34;how did you get those curls?!&#34; and at the end of the day saying, &#34;Wow! Your curls lasted all day!&#34;<br /><br />2. Heat setting. For my hair type, I vary between the 8 or 10 second mark, always on the high heat setting. I like the looser curls. Sometimes on my day two dry hair I will lightly spray some thermal protection on my hair and let it try before I use the product.<br /><br />3. Don't take more than 1&#34; of hair. There will be a beep, and the brushless motor won't do it's thing.<br /><br />4. COMB through the hair you want to curl. Don't just grab a half inch of unkempt hair and expect a nice looking smooth curl.<br /><br />5. Use the cleaner that came with your curl secret. Wait until your curler is cool and then twirl that thing around in the chamber a few times.<br /><br />6. Don't panic if your hair gets stuck. I had this happen once because I foolishly tried to curl in excess of 1&#34;. No hair was pulled out and I didn't lose any hair. There is a safety feature and thank goodness for that - so if there is a misfeed you'll release the clamp and your hair will come out.<br /><br />Now go have fun curling your hair with a curler that will cut your styling time down in the morning!br /><br />6. Don't panic if your hair gets stuck. I had this happen once because I foolishly tried to curl in excess of 1&#34;. No hair was pulled out and I didn't lose any hair. There is a safety feature and thank goodness for that - so if there is a misfeed you'll release the clamp and your hair will come out.<br /><br />Now go have fun curling your hair with a curler that will cut your styling time down in the morning!
  213. Simply put, I love this thing. I have incredibly straight and curl-resistant hair, and have previously never been able to maintain anything even *resembling* a curl/wave for more than ten minutes. Based on my hair's history, I was pretty skeptical about Curl Secret - I just didn't think it would work well for me. I was very happy to be proven wrong! First things first, this tool is very simple to use. I'm not a professional hair stylist by any means, but I know how to work a straightener and curling iron pretty well. This is much more user-friendly than both of those. I know that others have complained about their hair getting caught in the device, but I feel like it would be really difficult to get it SO caught that you'd be forced to resort to cutting it out. (For reference, my hair has gotten tangled in it before, but it's been really easy to remove). Second, it doesn't take an eternity to curl your entire head with this tool. I have fairly long hair, and, while fine, there's a lot of it. It takes me about 15 minutes to get the look I want. Third (and most importantly), I absolutely love the results I get with Curl Secret - loose, bouncy curls that actually last all day. All I have to do is use a little hairspray and I'm good to go. When all is said and done, I'd recommend Curl Secret to anyone looking for a quick, effective, and easy-to-use hair tool. It's one of the best I've ever bought.

  249. My hair is crazy long. Think, &#34;That girl's hair must tickle the top of her bum,&#34; long. It is also very thick and straight. I have always had problems curling my hair in the past. I've tried traditional curling irons, wands (which work but they're never long enough), hot rollers, soup cans, rag curls, over-night rollers, those rolling sticks things, really, you name it, I've tried it. Any way I tried the curls wouldn't last longer than an hour if I didn't use a very questionable, not to mention dangerous, amount of hair spray. Even then they usually didn't last more than 3 hours - tops. I was so frustrated and about to give up on anything resembling effort when it came to the styling of these luscious locks. Then I stumbled across this crazy gadget.<br />This thing is high speed, low drag (you know my story but not my swag). You just put a reasonable amount of hair in the snapper and it sucks it right up! Now that's what I call a good use of technology. There is nothing more satisfying than hearing those little beeps that mean &#34;Hey, your hair's done!,&#34; except maybe a good slice of pizza or my mom's pie. Anyway, the only thing I must warn you about is also the best quality of the machine: the vacuum. While this little baby is slurping in your hair it also might get hair that's not meant to go into it, causing a chain of profanities to escape our lips which are not at all lady-like. Make sure to clearly part the sections of hair you wish to be heated into curly goodness and that they are tangle free. You're in for a real treat when you realize the awful mistake you made with putting in the piece you know may have been too big or had knots in it. Prepare for the fight of your life!.........In reality, it's not that bad, just need a firm pull on the thing and usually the hair comes out. All in all, this is a really good product. Fun to use and effective on a very troublesome type of hair. I highly recommend getting this if you think curling hair has to bea big battle. FYI, it doesn't have to be.

  270. Wifes red hair to waist, awsome curls, love it! This is a great product a little expensive thou, but worth the curls.
  271. My hair has never got stuck and it does what it claims to. I have medium length thick hair so my curls did not come out as spiraled as on the box but its still a great effortless curl. very fast and easy!
  272. This was a gift for a granddaughter who likes to curl her's and her friends hair. She loves it a lot!
  273. I was extremely reluctant to try this product especially because of the cost and only did so because of the rave reviews. My hair is thin and lacks body, all the more reason I thought this curler would never work. But I must say that I am amazed by the results! I'm not one to write reviews but had to if it helps someone that's as undecided as I was.<br /><br />I bought this about a week ago (used the $20 coupon at Harmons/Bed, Bath & Beyond so paid a total cost of $80) and have used it twice since. After only one try, I didn't hesitate using it again for New Year's Eve last night (attending a party with 350 guests).<br /><br />It heats up quickly, it's lightweight and not cumbersome, it's easy to use and gets the job done quickly. I've tried all three size curls and they are all different from the other. The curls stay at least a couple of days, even the most loose curl which is the 8 second setting. I've showered with these curls, have washed my car, worked out and they're still there.<br /><br />There is a noticeable difference in hair style as I've gotten so many compliments, all telling me they prefer me in the curls! It's so simple and quick to use, the extra step in getting out of the house is worth it! I feel as if I have so much hair now and it has bounce and body. I highly recommend this product!
  274. Okay, first off I love this product. I've never had it get stuck in the machine and for everyone saying it does, you have to read and follow the instructions! I have long hair down to the middle of my back and this works perfectly! Coming from someone who was a big fan of a curling wand, I like this product a lot better. This truly does take a lot less time. With the wand it takes me about 2 hours to do my whole head and with curl secret it takes me about an hour! I think my only down fall on this product is that it makes your hair smell pretty burnt, but most heat products do that.<br /> With this product you need to absolutely make sure your hair is clean and tangle free! You also need to use 1/2-1 in pieces and if you have bigger it won't even suck up the hair. Also the side of the barrel where you can see inside needs to be facing your head. If you follow these rules this product will do wonders!<br /> I hope this helps everyone!
  275. Love love love!!! I can do my whole head in less than 15 minutes. I put some moose in my hair after the shower then let it dry or blow dry. My curls last for days !

  277. The product works very well for my hair. I have extremely straight hair, about shoulder length long. Historically, curling irons and curlers do not work for very long, and I end up with no curl within a few hours.<br />When I curl my hair with the Infiniti Pro, my curls are still in place the next morning after I sleep on it!<br />I'm not giving the product a 5 for the following reasons:<br />1) The constant beeping is a bit annoying.<br />2) I've actually used another brand of a similar product (Vida brand) that got a little hotter, had a longer timer, and alternated right & left spin directions. I did not re-purchase the Vida because it malfunctioned on me, and the Infiniti Pro has not done that yet.<br />3) After extended use in one setting, it seems like the curler will start snagging a little more frequently. I usually just turn it off, let it cool for a few moments, then start up again. It heats back up VERY QUICKLY!<br />4) When (not if) your hair does snag, it can be a little frightening trying to get your hair out before it burns. Luckily, I've had not catastrophic disasters. You just need to be diligent about the amount of hair you use for each section & how close you are to flyaways or loose hairs from outside the hair section you are curling.

The second time I used it, I was really careful to keep the barrel facing my head and it worked beautifully. I have very fine blonde hair in long layers (ranging from my chin to the middle of my back). What I love about this iron is I don't have to separate my layers so much to get perfect curls. It goes very quickly if I use the high setting on medium and 10 seconds. The curls last 2-3 days. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and family! What a fun product!
  319. Ok, my hair NEVER, EVER, EVER, EVER... like EVER holds curl. This device let's me curl my hair easily, and get this... holds the curl all day with NO HAIRSPRAY!!! Yep. No spray! I do put a little spray on the top of my hair just to hold the top like i want it, but the curls, get nothing. And they really do last all day!<br />The trick to the Curl Secret is to not put too thick of a section in your hair at once, and after I pick the section I run a brush though it just to make sure it's not tangled at all. If I was to section my hair off this way and use a regular iron, I'd be there for a good hour. This takes me 30 minutes or less for my whole head! I can't give this thing enough stars!!!

  325. I just bought this product last night at Ulta Beauty with a 20% off one item coupon, making it $80+tax. I have hair that reaches just above my belly button, so I was wary that I would be able to use it. I did some internet searching, however, and found videos from Conair of very long hair being curled. So I decided to give it a shot -- after all I could return it easily enough.<br /><br />So, I have very long hair that is very thick (I'm a redhead). I read the directions, watched a few videos, and set to work. I made sure to use small sections and I used high heat, 12 seconds. I clipped part of my hair on top of my head and worked in sections. I loved the machine from the first curl! 12 seconds is not very long, so before you know it each curl is done. It did not take me more than 18 minutes to curl my entire head of hair, using small sections. I can easily spend 25-30 minutes with other curling irons/wands/etc and not get the same uniform result. That is the best thing about this -- uniform result! I did not find that it was bulky or tiring by the time I was done.<br /><br />I had the hair tangle a couple times but nothing big. The machine let go of the hair immediately. I found that in each time, I had not properly smoothed/combed out that section. One of the times I think I had too much hair in it. Regardless, the tangles were very easy to clear. There is no brush inside the motor, so it's not like your hair is catching on internal bristles.<br /><br />So how did it curl? Well I was a little disappointed with the 12 second curl. That is, until I was all done and ready to finish the style. I waited for the curls to cool, put some smoothing cream in, some hair spray, then hand-tousled my hair. Woowza!! I had curl galore! It was gorgeous. I then slept on it. Today, I have gorgeous beach waves and still have some defined curl ringlets. The clip-less interior combined with perfect all-around heating really does make curls last longer (just don't touch until they are cool!). My hair curls well but it doesn't always hold well. It will hold extra body until I wash it, but not much more than that. For me to have very well defined waves and a few ringlets after sleeping on it is an EXCELLENT result. I am thrilled. For 18 minutes styling time (and that was my first time), I feel this is well worth it, because my hair is going to have style and wave until I wash it again.<br /><br />I can also imagine so many uses for this. For example, creating a simple ponytail with perfect ringlets. That should be quick, easy, and very pretty!<br /><br />One final FYI: I was reading through the manual and discovered that this machine has a 5 year warranty. Awesome! So save your receipts.<br /><br />Cons:<br />Expensive (but I feel it's worth it -- try using an Ulta 20% off coupon!)<br /><br />Pros:<br />Super Quick, Uniform Curls (18 minutes for super long, super thick hair)<br />Long Lasting Result<br />Multiple Uses (like curling ponytail strands)<br />5 Year Warranty<br />Gorgeous Hair!!<br /><br />I truly do love this product, but please keep in mind I've only used this product ONCE. But hey, think about what it says that I am giving it rave reviews already! I will try to update this review as I use the product more. But if you are on the fence, pick this product up from somewhere that you can easily return it -- then the dilemma is solved :)

  334. I used this yesterday, Christmas Day, on my straight, long hair. It tangled a bunch of times. Also, the curls didn't seem uniform. I fully intended to return the thing. But then, every time I passed a mirror and caught myself, I really loved how my hair looked. The curls really weren't uniform, but they looked natural. That &#34;beachy&#34; look that I'm always trying to achieve - this was it. My mother said it looked messy, but in a good way. I took a nap on the couch and the curls still looked good after. I slept on them last night, they still look good today. So now I think I'll end up using it often. It's a pretty quick way to get curls and I think, with practice, I will be able to avoid tangling. I would say that this product is best for straight hair. Tangling occurred when I didn't have a smooth section. I would imaging trying to curl wavy or frizzy hair would be very difficult.
  335. There is definitely a learning curve with this product. The first time you use it, you'll definitely get your hair stuck in it, despite the fact that the product says \\"guaranteed no tangles.\\" You need to practice using this tool, and each time you'll become better and faster at it.<br /><br />I have always had the kind of hair that no matter how much heat, styling, gel, or spray I use, my curls are falling out while I'm in the car on my way to the event. I was very skeptical about using the curl secret because I have never found anything that worked for me. I tried \\"curling\\" shampoos and conditioners that \\"help your hair retain curls or styling better,\\" hot rollers, foam rollers, curling irons, etc. etc.<br /><br />In addition to my hair losing its style, I have never really been \\"good\\" at doing hair. Growing up when girlfriends asked me to do their hair I would groan because I didn't even know how to do my own hair. It's no surprise that at nearly 30, I still can't do my hair ;-) Some days, even mastering a pony tail is a struggle!<br /><br />The Curl Secret looked so easy to use. I heard about how it was \\"different\\" because it heats your hair on all sides and retains your style better, so I decided to try it out. The first time I used it was ok - it took forever, I didn't have a lot of volume on top of my head, and boy did I get my hair tangled in it. You cannot put strands of hair wider than 1/2\\"- maybe 1\\" wide in the tool. When using this tool against your scalp, the more fanned-out your hair is at the top near your scalp, the more likely the tool is to get stuck and rip your hair out. I have learned a few tricks to using this tool that seem to make it better and easier for me, and each time I use it I get faster. I'm sure that this would be even easier and faster if you had someone to help you out!<br /><br />When using this tool, I do my hair in \\"tiers.\\" First I part the lower 1/4 of my hair with a comb and clip the rest to the top my head. Then I work my way around the half-circle of my neck/lower scalp using about 1/2\\" - 1\\" sections, keeping the sections parted \\"vertically\\" rather than fanned out horizontally (if that makes sense). Continue curling hair \\"in tiers,\\" using a comb to create the next part and clip the other \\"tiers\\" to the top of the head. Working though each \\"tier\\" is another system of smaller pins and clips until each \\"tier\\" or \\"level\\" is curled. Finally, I end with the top of my head, which helps to achieve more volume. Maybe this \\"trick\\" isn't a secret, but as someone who is terrible at doing hair, I thought it was a revelation!<br /><br />Be sure when you open the tool and release your hair that you don't \\"drag\\" the iron down your hair. That is, be sure to open the tool and kind of \\"dump\\" the curl out of the barrel. This will keep you from using the tool like a straighening iron. I found the first few times I used this, I was pulling the tool down the curls and straightening them out a bit and losing some curl. The curl needs a few seconds to set.<br /><br />I don't use any product or sprays to get the curls to stay, which AMAZES ME, because again, I have always been the type to lose my hairstyle before I even get to an event. It is shocking to come home from an event hours later and have my curls intact, especially without use of any styling sprays or products. I have even gone to bed and woken up with my hair still curly (albeit sloppy bed-head curls). I don't know what that other person was talking about being disappointed that their curls last \\"only\\" 2 days - this isn't a PERM, it's a daily styling tool.<br /><br />I attached some picture of my hair after using this product because sometimes seeing is believing (assuming Amazon approved and posted the images I shared). I get tons of compliments when I curl my hair with the Curl Secret. It's no secret that I'm not very skilled with my hair, so it's always awesome to be able to respond, \\"thank you! Why YES, I DID do my hair myself!\\" :-)<br /><br />Please feel free to ask any questions and I will do my best to answer them as best as I can!ir myself!\\" :-)<br /><br />Please feel free to ask any questions and I will do my best to answer them as best as I can!
  336. It got tangled in my hair. Very scary sinc it was hot and could have burned my hair. Pulled the plug and my husband helped get my hair loose from the thing.
  337. My hair is stick straight and the curls were still there the next morning. I love this tool and would recommend it.
  338. I own the Bling Curl Secret purchased from Ulta. My hair is long and fine and has trouble holding a curl. This machine makes a perfect curl every time and it holds pretty well. Keep in mind that like most things, there is a learning curve. Hair will tangle if it is not combed smooth and if too much hair is fed into the machine. Patience is a virtue and will be tested at first. Don't get discouraged though. It's totally with every penny.
  339. The first time I used it, on the third strand of hair, it yanked it up into the machine, made a noise and stalled out. I quickly unplugged it and had to get my daughter and husband to help me get my hair out. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone I cared about.
  340. I have very thick hair, medium length hair and after reading several positive reviews, I thought I would purchase the Infiniti and give it a shot. When I got it home, I read the directions, tried it on the high setting and it only curled (and very loosely) the top part of the my hair. The end strands were basically just &#34;curved&#34;, not the twisty type of curl you see in the ads and on the box. So just to make sure I was doing it right, I viewed several you-tube videos, including the one that Conair put out. So I gave it another shot, still the same. I decided to return it. $100 bucks is too much to spend on something that does not work, at least for me. I do not understand how this can curl so well for everyone else but I was not at all happy with it.

  349. I can't tell you the amount of complements that I have received since purchasing this contraption a couple weeks ago. I could never master curling my hair the conventional way so I decided to buy the infiniti pro by conair. After reading extensive reviews on this product I decided to purchase it. The only negative comment that I would make about this product is that my hair was caught in the spinning mechanism a couple times. The positive aspect of this is that there is a unlocking feature that beeps and lets go of the hair automatically. Just make sure to keep it at the recommended 1/2 inch to inch piece of hair and you'll be fine. Over filling the compartment is why my hair was caught in the first place. Definitely worth the $100. I have very thick long hair that hangs down to my middle back. It takes me about 30-40 minutes at most to complete my entire head. I would recommend this product to anyone. 5 stars!
  350. This product is amaaaaaaazing! It truly works as advertised! So simple to use. I love it!

  352. My daughter's hair is long and quite thin. She had it set in the highest heat and the longest time. It made a very limp and lifeless wave at best. Product is being returned.
  353. The curls are beautiful. Need to do a small amount of hair at one time or it will not curl your hair.
  354. I love this thing so much! Honestly I can say that I was quite scared about using it after some of the reviews saying their hair was getting caught but I have had it almost three weeks and I have curled my hair with this at lease 6 times by now and I haven't had any problems. It has a feature on it that beeps if you put it in wrong or if there was too much hair so that really helps. I have really thick hair and it's about three inches past my shoulders and it takes about 15-20 minutes to do my whole head. It's also really easy so it's meant for those that find themselves incapable of using any other iron. It's important to be patient and don't try to rush it, then you won't have any problems and it will be surprisingly quick and easy.

  363. First time out of the box it was usable. I fully expected to have to be extremely patient to get the learning curve. I watched a tutorial on You Tube first, which I think it helped.<br /><br />The curls are crazy good, very uniform and nice!<br /><br />Don't try to rush by putting too much hair in at once or it can tangle, but it does have the ability to detangle easily. That is what I was most afraid of with this device, but it's all good.<br /><br />I can have curly hair, neato!
  364. This really works! I was skeptical and thought it might pull out chunks of hair when it &#34;sucked&#34; in the hair. Not true. It automatically stops if it tangles or pulls at the roots. You can easily get as tight or loose a curl as you want by adjusting the heat setting or time setting.
  365. I was hesitant to spend so much money on this, but I'm so glad I did. I struggle constantly to curl my hair with a curling wand, and I'm sure I'm not the only one. This product takes ALL the struggle out of curling my hair. There are 3 curl settings which vary the tightness of the curls. The lowest one gives me what I like to call \\"Kate Middleton hair.\\" I'm not even kidding. My hair looks exactly like hers. The middle setting gives a little tighter curl, but still loose enough. The highest setting gives a tight curl, but I don't use it. Perhaps even better than achieving Kate Middleton hair, is how long these curls last. My hair curls easily, but by the end of an 8-10 hour day, my curling wand curls have mostly fallen out (and that's with A LOT of hairspray). With this tool, I barely use any hairspray, and my curls last forever! I can even brush the curls out and they still last. I've even slept with my hair curled, and my hair still looks perfect the next day. If you're hesitant on buying this, don't be!! It's well worth the money!!!!!<br /><br />To add to my review, I have pretty fine hair that falls a little below my shoulders. This tool gives me lots of body, which is something I've always wanted. Also, I feel the need to clarify on how to use this: You can only curl 1/2-1\\" sections of hair at at a time. If you try more than that (or get the tool too close to your scalp) the tool just \\"spits out\\" your hair. I've never had trouble with my hair getting stuck or tangled inside the tool, so other people who said that may have just been using it wrong. Try not to get baby hairs or really really small sections caught in your main section that you're curling - I've found that this tends to a) make the tool spit out your hair or b) make your baby hairs get sucked into the tool with the main section, which pulls them quite a bit in the process (which is slightly painful).
  366. I love this! The curls are much better than a curling iron
  367. I really didn't know what to think when I ordered this, but I was pleasantly surprised. In all my years of using curling irons, I could never achieve the perfect curl I get with this time and time again. You can curl your hair rather quickly with it. I have received many compliments on my hair since using it. My hair is fine and straight by the way.
  368. works great on all hair lengths.   411. okay, so after reading reviews for a few months, i decided to finally get this and try it out. it's on the pricer end of curling irons. but i love curling my hair. BE WARNED: using this iron does have a learning curve. my first few tries with the thing were very disappointing. my curls were not coming out, they barely resembled any type of curl. until i realized that after the 8-12 second beep/hold you have to let go of the handle and let the curl drop out without touching the edges of the iron, rather than pulling the curl from the device as you would with a curling iron. as soon as i mastered that slight detail, my curls came out picture perfect! it's totally worth the purchase. the settings really do let you create loose to tight curls. i was a bit skeptical at first (thinking i might need to hold the hair in longer than the 12 seconds) for a tighter one, but if you do it correctly it will produce a cute tight curl.<br /><br />my hair is medium shoulder length and the iron worked like magic!! make sure you practice with it a few times before using it for a big night out. :)

  426. Let me start by saying I SUCK at doing hair. So bad. Before yesterday my hair styles included stick straight, messy bun, and natural waves. I have never been able to curl my hair. They turned out SO pretty, though a little more curly than I like, next time I will use the middle setting. Not only did they stay all night, but my hair was still perfectly curled the next day! I'm not going to say this is the easiest or fastest way to curl your hair, because its not. However, if your hair has problems holding a curl or if you are just terrible at using curling irons, buy this NOW. As for my hair getting tangled, it happened twice during my first use. It wasn't terrible, there was no pain, my hair came out easily and I just brushed out the strand and did it again. I learned pretty fast that if you put more than what you can fit inside the little hook then it's going to get stuck. This thing is pretty heavy, so be prepared for that. I was worried about doing the back of my head with this, but it wasn't hard at all. Overall this is probably my favorite hair purchase ever. I'm so so so happy with it!
  427. I bought this item elsewhere. I am NOT Amazon verified.... all my other reviews aread on purchases I def made here on Amazon. I love Amazon.<br /><br />I truly despise this item. It no way is &#34;great&#34; or wonderful and the directions are idiotic. I have a high level of intelligence. I tried this item and then came back here, fully expecting to hear similar stories... but no-- apparently I am the idiot who doesn't follow directions, otherwise I would be delighted and buying this for half my family and friends.<br /><br />My issues:<br /><br />It's a Conair: made in China. Cheap parts, cheap labor = cheap product. Conair has ALWAYS sucked. It is way too hot and the motor sounds like it had a problem the first time I attempted to use it. The heat is way too hot. For the person who said 'go ahead and leave your hair in the chamber longer is a MORON. You'll burn your hair off. The missing automatic release feature is just proof that it's cheap. All the beeping in the world won't prevent you from burning your hair.<br /><br />The item is super picky about how you hold it, how you put the hair in and how the hair is presented. Not only do you have to comb, de-tangle and smooth out every tress -- but you will have to probably do it at least twice more for every other curl made. People on here say that you are a moron if you don't follow those directions... well I followed them and my hair still got stuck despite being detangled, smooth, etc etc.<br /><br />The 1/2 -1&#34; guideline of how much hair you have to put in the 'chamber' is serious. You can't put more in. Say each section takes the average time of 10 seconds to heat and you have 30 seconds per side, 30 sections on the back = 90 sections. (remember this is 1/2 - 1&#34; sections-- so this is actually the best case scenario) Apply some simple math and you've got 30min. Which doesn't seem like a lot, but remember, you have to spend an appropriate amount of time combing, detangling (or risk being the moron who can't follow directions) section your hair off into at least three large sections, THEN you need to pull each section out, comb, de-tangle, suck it in and THEN wait the 10 seconds, then take it out, move it over, comb, de-tangle, suck it in, and THEN wait the 10 seconds. So in my case, apparently I am the &#34;idiot&#34; here who doesn't like this item, it took me over 50 minutes to do a half-assed job that I ended up putting in a messy bun. At least half the time, it didn't &#34;like&#34; the way I put my hair in.<br /><br />I don't know about anyone else -- but if you are over 30 like me, you don't a) don't care that much about ONE hair style -- and b) your arms are going to get tired.<br /><br />If it was possible to give a negative star rating I would.o can't follow directions) section your hair off into at least three large sections, THEN you need to pull each section out, comb, de-tangle, suck it in and THEN wait the 10 seconds, then take it out, move it over, comb, de-tangle, suck it in, and THEN wait the 10 seconds.   433. This tool does to my hair what the Chi flat iron does to my hair, only it makes it curly instead of flat; but the point is that it is quick & easy and my hair cuticle is flattened making it look lush and shiny. I have somewhat coarse wavy/curly hair and this makes the frizz go away and my curls look normal - not a frizz fest. This is actually faster than a flat iron for me because my hair really fights being straight, but seems to love to curl. I can do my whole head of tons of hair in half the time of any other iron - flat or otherwise. Plus, I didn't have any problems with tangling and I have long hair (about 2-3 inches below my brastrap).<br />Highly recommended!!!!!

  436. Very good and easy to use
  437. I was very nervous about dropping a hundred bucks on a hair styling tool of all things, but I'm really glad I did! I watched a couple of YouTubers try it out and decided it was worth an investment. I am the woman with the pink hair in the product images; my hair is product-free in the images and I took the photos after using the Curl Secret and then going out for the day.<br /><br />I think preference will vary from person to person with this product. I can absolutely see why some people who try this out still prefer more traditional curling tools. If you have trouble getting your curls to look right? Try this if you've been thinking about getting it. It does all the work for you and takes roughly the same amount of time as a curling iron. It's not super speedy or magical, but it's a really good tool! It's especially good for people who can't get the hang of clipless curling irons and are sick of dents being left by the traditional irons that have clips.<br /><br />Some things I was asked by friends when I told them about it, answered:<br />-- Yes, it's easy! Case in point: I had my completely hair clueless husband do the back of my hair for me the other day and he did just fine!<br />-- Yes, it works! I get great curls and they REALLY last, even without product (this will range based on hair type, most likely.)<br />-- No, it does not eat/trap your hair while it's curling! The &#34;hold&#34; is very loose and, unless you manage to severely tangle yourself in it, it lets go just like that as soon as you release the clamp.<br />-- Yes, you CAN get your hair stuck in it if you put too much in or partially miss the feed when inserting your hair. No, it is not hard to get it back out, and no, it is not hard to get your hair correctly fed through.<br />-- No, it does not damage hair (no more than any other heating tool does, anyway.) My hair feels just as soft as before using it and there is no &#34;crispiness.&#34;<br />-- Yes, it works on long hair, though it works best on hair that's above shoulder length to just past the shoulders in length. If your hair is halfway down your back this may only be good for curls that start partway up instead of near the root. If that's what you prefer, awesome!<br /><br />To avoid your hair getting stuck*:<br />-- Read the instructions. No brainer, I know!<br />-- Make sure your hair is tangle free before using.<br />-- Do not try to feed too much hair into it. 1.5&#34;-1&#34; is about as much as it can take.<br />-- Mind the feed (stay to the middle.)<br />-- Don't hold it backwards! The open side (with the exposed end of the barrel and text on the plastic) should be the side facing your scalp.<br /><br />*Sometimes it just happens, especially when you're doing the back of your head yourself! It's not hard to miss the feed when it's in your blind spot, but it's not as scary as it sounds. Don't panic; don't yank or tug. Remember: A few extra seconds of heat while you get your hair out isn't going to burn it off. Untangling it usually takes less time than it takes for properly fed hair to curl, but rough treatment may tear your hair out or get you legitimately stuck. The feed will push your hair out a bit so you can release pressure on the clamp and pull it out, holding by the roots with your fingers and wiggling gently as you go. 9/10 that's all it takes.
  438. PERFECT! Make perfect curls Love it!
  439. Very good product as shown in the page for a very good price !! I recommend, and hope you enjoy like me !
  440. I have been through so many hair curlers growing up and the curls never lasted longer then 1 hour. I've had long hair down to my waist to shoulder length hair. I changed to the heated hair curlers that you leave in for about an hour or so but it so time consuming not only do u have the time to put the curlers in you have that time you need to wait and leave it in.<br /><br />This hair curler is AWESOME! You need to make sure you don't put more then 1/2 inch of hair into the product to get some really good curls. I've tried it on my hair (little past my shoulders) and my daughters (her hair goes past her waist, very long) and for both hair types I have the same conclusion for how much hair you should put in to curl. Also there is a note on the curler that tells you which side should face your head so you don't put your hair in the wrong way and get a pull from your scalp, I'm sure that would really hurt. You must make sure there are not tangles in your hair so there is no pull. The timer will beep when you should release. Now, heres the thing......I found that you need to do it twice on the same strand or else you will end up with more of a wave then an actual curve. Now this may be different for others depending on your hair type. Our hair type is just really straight, this may be the reason for needing to do it twice on the same strand. I tried to just leave it in the curler longer then the beep but that does not work. It really needs to be ran through twice. Now some may thing thats a lot of work but these curls last a really long time. My daughter and I have very thick straight hard to style hair and the curls lasted till the next day with NO product in our hair!!! Its well worth it in my opinion!!! What I love about this curler is you don't need to worry about bumping it because it will not burn out. The only area that you need to be careful of is the side that faces the head. The actual hot curler faces your head so just make sure you dont have it touch your skin and you will be fine. Another thing I love about this product is while the hair is in the curler you or the person you are curling can move and not worry about pull! The hair will simply come out and unravel off the curler a bit, which is great if you are trying to curl a child's hair! I did try to use it on low but you will not get much of a curl with a low setting so if you do want some really nice curls you need to have it on high. Its really not that complicated to use its very easy to catch on.
  441. I love the quality of the curl I get from this curling iron. The only drawback is the occasional tangle. Once you learn how to use it, this doesn't happen often. Curl small sections and if you get a tangle, turn the iron off and be patient while you detangle.

  450. I apologize in advance for the lengthy review..... I was on a trip in Dallas Tx, had forgot my hair styling products and tools, so I thought I'd try this. Before I purchased it, I read reviews and have to say I was scared to death after reading the reviews of hair getting caught and/or having to cut/pry hair off/out of device. I decided to try it anyways and started with a section of hair that would not be as noticeable if it did get caught. Thankfully I had no issues.<br /><br />I loved this product. The curls lasted all night and the following day. The curls did not dry, damage or frizz my hair. What I loved about this curling iron is the curls always come out the same and were consistently beautiful curls.<br /><br />I typically use the Instyler curling iron if I wear my hair straight and want a little boost (the curls don't last otherwise) or Caruso steam curlers if I want curls in my hair which last 1-2 days and works beautifully with no damage (this is not always convenient carrying around rollers in a bag when traveling.) I have very fine, thick, hard to curl hair that easily tangles because it is so fine. My hair length is past the middle of my back almost to my waist. I have heavy high-lights on my hair, so I only curl my hair on occasions because of the time it takes to roll my hair and to prevent additional damage to my hair from curling irons.<br /><br />Because I have hard to curl hair, I have to use the highest setting that is supposed to give the tightest curl with the Infiniti Pro. The curls I get are loose, full body curls, like you see in magazines. It is very important to use the small sections as recommended. If you get too much hair in the iron, it will beep at you and won't take your hair. I find the best result with my hair, to start the curls about 2-3&#34; from my head because of the length. It is also important to get the best results to have clean hair with no or very little product and comb out all tangles. Since getting the InfinitiPro I have numerous people complimenting me on my hair and recommending I keep it curled. ;)<br /><br />I hope this review helps someone else who is scared to purchase this product. It is quite intimidating with the cost and the thought of having to cut your hair. Good Luck!

Its easy as that...<br /><br />Enjoy!:)

  542. I have very thin, fine hair, with an ugly kind of light kinky frizz. I had been blow drying my hair straight for years, which is a process. If I use a curling iron, the curls don't stay in for more than a couple hours, even if I use half a can of hairspray. And if there's any humidy, forget about it. I bought this at WalMart, figuring it wasn't going to work and I was going to have to take it back. It ended up being the best $100 I've ever spent on a hair product.<br /> I have found that in order for the curl to stay in my hair, I have to do very small sections of hair, so it takes me an hour to curl my whole head. But the curls actually stay in for days, until the next time I wash my hair. I have gone 5 days and the curl was still in. I do have to touch up a few curls everyday (some come out depending on how I sleep and I have one small section of hair that just won't hold a curl overnight), but it only takes me 10 minutes to touch up. It has saved me so much time getting ready in the morning. And I love my hair curly! I get so many compliments on it all the time. I have curl and body in my hair and even in some humidity, my curls stay in and don't frizz! On the day the do my whole head, I use the high heat setting and the 12 second timer (which is the longest) so I get the tightest curl and it will last. For touch ups, I use low heat and the 10 second timer so I don't over fry my hair. Using this for 2 months I haven't really noticed my hair being any more damaged than normal. Also, I do prep with a shampoo, conditioner and hair products for curly hair. When I haven't, it doesn't curl as well or stay in as long. May just be my hair.<br />Warning, your hair will get stuck from time to time. Only once in the almost 2 months I have been using it did my hair get really stuck that I panicked a little. All the other times, you get to know the sound and release the handle and your hair comes out. What I have found you need to do in order to prevent this is use a fine tooth comb to comb out each strand before you curl it. I do that and spray it with a heat protectant spray each time I curl. The times it has started getting stuck is when I get lazy and don't brush out the strand. There are tons of You Tube videos out there. Take a look and you will find someone with your hair type that is using it so you can get an idea. I highly recommend this and love, love, love it.

  555. I read a lot of reviews on here, and some were negative, but most were positive so I decided to give this a try.<br /><br />The problem I had with regular curling irons is that the bottom of my hair always got crimped in a weird way, I burned myself a lot, and it took so long to get it all curled.<br /><br />Now, if you follow the directions with facing the barrel towards your head, make sure your hair isn't tangled, and don't put too much hair in the machine it will work great. My hair is on the fine side and straight but curls pretty easily, so I followed the directions and it worked great. I only use the highest heat and number setting because i figured the curls will relax after some time. I sectioned off my hair and sprayed with hairspray after I was done with each section. I curled my hair in the morning and for the most part it lasted through the night, with some curls loosening only a bit.<br /><br />I feel like it takes less time to curl my hair and each curl comes out awesome if done right. Also, if you feel your hair pulling the wrong way in the barrel, the machine WILL stop itself, but you'll feel it even before that machine beeps and once you loosen your grip on the curler you should be able to get your hair out no problem. I highly recommend!!!!!!

  564. My husband bought me this for Christmas - I absolutely love it! My hair is a couple of inches past my shoulders, not thick but not thin, not coarse but not fine, and I keep it permed so that I can just &#34;scrunch & go&#34; when I want to wear it down, but most days I just put it up in a messy pony/bun type of thing because I'm usually wearing workout clothes. I've decided that I don't want to go with the &#34;scrunch & go&#34; look anymore - so when I do want to wear it down, this curler helps to smooth out the frizziness and is allowing my hair to grow out gracefully, sort of.<br /><br />This curler works great on my hair type. Once I got past the &#34;learning curve&#34;, it now takes me 10-15 minutes to do my whole head, using the 12-second setting. I put the top section of my hair up in a clippy, and do the bottom part first. I do take fairly small sections, and YOU HAVE TO MAKE SURE YOU HAVE THE CORRECT SIDE OF THE CURLER FACING YOUR HEAD! Otherwise it's going to tangle your hair in the curler - been there, done that. But when it starts to tangle, you can feel it, and if you let go right away you can avoid the tangle. You also have to let go of the end of your hair at the same time you close the handle, otherwise it's going to tangle. So, there is definitely a learning curve, and if you're &#34;directionally challenged&#34;, this may not be the curler for you. My curls last all day, my hair feels very soft (not crispy or over-heated).... in short, I'm very happy with this product.

Also the results were almost never just the way I wanted it to look: natural and even. Now that is all a thing of the past. After experimenting a bit with the different heat settings and how much hair to put in at a time etc. I got the hang of it very quickly. It is truly easy to use, but it also creates the most beautiful and natural looking curls and waves. Also a great feature: the beep lets you know when it's set so no more overheating hair. I have gotten countless comments since I use the Curl Secret. Mostly people thought I just came from a high class salon.
