  577. I got the Curl Secret today and was so excited to try it out! I was a little apprehensive, seeing as I read some reviews that hair got stuck and had to be cut out or that it didn't work on thick hair. For the record, I have normal hair(and lots of it!) halfway down my back. I read all of the instructions first, which I highly recommend. It has to heat settings and 3 different timer settings. When curling my hair with a curling iron I crank it way up, but I only used the low heat setting and it curled just fine. It will only take around 1/2&#34; of hair at a time and I brushed each 1/2&#34; section before sticking it in the Curl Secret hoping that would help prevent my hair from getting stuck. I was SUPER excited when perfect curls fell right out! You have to make sure you keep it closed and it will start beeping, but don't open it until you hear the 4 quick beeps in a row. It was a little awkward at times since you have to use your right hand, but not too bad. It makes a loud beeping sound if you put in too much hair or if it starts to get caught. I'm not sure how anyone got their hair caught enough to have to cut it out, but my hair caught in it a few times and it stopped spinning and my hair came out easily, no scissors required to free it! I had to go over a few pieces twice because the curl looked a little weird, but I think it just takes more practice to get it the first time. Overall, I LOVE this! I was never good at curling my hair and the curl always fell right away, but this has lasted all night. Just remember...READ THE DIRECTIONS FIRST!!! :)
  578. I have short hair a bit shorter than shoulder length. The curling iron doesn't leave a tight hold in my hair. I believe it is because it is too short and it is wanting more to hold on to for a tighter curl. I am growing my hair out so I can try it again. I'm looking for a tight curl that I can finger through and loosen.<br />My hair is great at holding curl, so that is not the issue.
  579. I'm not sure about the description of this product. My hair doesn't come out as curly as the description says it will when set to a certain setting. Overall I'm satisfied
  580. If you have fine hair like mine, nothing curls it easily and curls do not stay long- this did not work well. Plus my hair is shoulder length which makes it worse. You have to use such a small amount of hair to get a curl, it would take forever to do my hair. If one has course hair and some natural curl, it may work well. A lot of money to be sitting around the house not being used.

  591. I bought this petrified and intrigued, I had read bad reviews, but loved the idea. I had my hair stylist on standby for when I ripped out chunks of my hair- like reviewers promised.<br />I believe in Conair Infinity Pro products (LOVELOVELOVE my Spin Brush), so I blew $100 on a chance. AND I LOVE THIS MACHINE. I read the directions! Weird! I have thick, colored/damaged hair mid-length down my back, I did my entire head in 30 minutes, first time, and my hair was not pulled once. It's not hard, girls! Keep the control buttons towards your head. And for those saying that larger sections were rejected- try try again. Don't put it so close to your head, I tried the same thing again and most of the time it worked, if not I moved it 3mm from the roots and blam, it worked. Another 'secret'- just because it beeps that it's not accepting the strand; it's still in the chamber, it's still curling. Wait a few seconds, it curls, whether it likes it or not... My hair looks great! It's actually ridiculous! It's curled, it feels healthy and soft. It's been over an hour since I did it and it looks exactly the same, no hair spray. Honestly, don't be afraid to try it, it's intimidating, but it's really a fun and awesome experience! My hair looks fantastic.

Then I did some research and found out that BaByliss Pro is the higher end professional use line done by the same company by Conair. I thought I had scored a more expensive item at the less expensive price, but then I did some MORE research and found out that the version I had was a fake. There are a few telltale graphical signs on the box (I knew that box looked off!) as well as on the device itself. Amazon processed a return label for me and helped me re-order the Infiniti Pro from a different seller, but I ended up canceling that order because I'm so annoyed with the whole process. I may do more research on the authentic MiraCurl and end up ordering that in the future.

As the other reviews say, it does take some practice, but once you get the hang of it, your hair is curled in no time. I get so many compliments when I curl my hair with the Pro Curler, even from people that I don't even know. My hair is fine and always seems limp, even when I use hot rollers. I have no hand/eye coordination so a wand never worked for me, and I never got the results that I do with this. The curls last forever as well. My sister was skeptical but once she tried it, she decided to go out to buy her own. I would recommend this product to anyone!
  687. This tool is a godsend. I've only touched my flat iron once, since purchasing this item. I've also put this puppy through the ringer. I've even used it on my hair after having it up the night before where my hair had air dried from a wet up do with plenty of product to give that natural curly look. It stood up to the test and even produced better results with the presence of the previous product. Surprised as even the instructional booklet explained that clean hair works best.<br /><br />I've seen a ton of negative results and I don't understand why. Folks are having a hard time getting this to work, or their hair gets caught up. If this happens to you... you're doing it wrong. I have extremely long thick hair and even with product have yet to get caught. There are mechanisms built into this item that help prevent situations in which it will &#34;eat&#34; your hair. Follow the instructions provided on how to insert/remove hair and there won't be an issue.<br /><br />I am thoroughly impressed with how long the curls hold. I've never had even half the success with a curling iron that I have with the Curl Secret. Plus... it is diverse in what kind of curls it provides. Less hair = tight curls and more hair = a slightly curly to wavy look. Try this out. It is definitely worth the money.
  688. If used correctly this thing is amazing!! I had my hair done by a professional for my sisters wedding and she used this on all of our hair. Our hair was done at 9am and the wedding wasn't until 4. The curls lasted all day, they were full and bouncy with no frizz. Needless to say ALL of the bridesmaids want to purchase one. The wedding photographer even asked about our hair and said that she will be purchasing one. The curls are amazing and so uniform. I highly suggest it!

I read the instructions, followed them, and everything worked exactly as said except for one major problem: NO CURLS!! It sucked my hair in, did the slow beeps and then the quicker consecutive beeping, I released, and my hair was NOT curly. I don't know if I got a defective one or what. I tried different settings, hoping for even a tiny bit of curl.... nothing. I tried it out several times, and did not experience the tangling or hair getting stuck that others have mentioned, but still no curls. Since that is the entire purpose of the devise, I will be returning this item and I have to give it one star. I have never had problems with my hair curling with any other curling irons (including many Conair ones), so it can't be my hair. I have never given anything a one star rating before, but it had ONE job, and that was to CURL my hair, which it did not do even a little.

  693. I have hair products up the wazoo. Every time a new product comes out I run out and try it. When this product first came out I didn't run out and try it because I JUST KNEW it wouldn't work. I have very thick, coarse, wavy hair so I like to straighten it and put just a little bit of wave in it. I was at the store and spotted the Infiniti Pro and decided to buy it because, what the heck I had a coupon and the store has super easy returns, and I just knew that I would return in the next day. I couldn't have been more wrong. Ladies I was amazed at how easy it was to use, how not tired my arms felt and how un-singed my fingers were. I have a wand and I would use the little glove to protect myself and I would always end up burning myself anyway. The only way to burn yourself with this thing is if you stick your finger in the dang chamber. Small sections is KEY. If you do it right you'll get the hang of it and it will take you less time than if you try to shove a bunch of hair in there thinking it will give you faster results. No dice. Follow the instructions, trust them, and practice makes perfect. :)

  698. Personally, I love this product. I have incredibly thick, coarse hair which is just above my shoulders. When blow dried it is typically wavy with some frizz. For years a flat iron (babyliss) has been my salvation. I have tried curling my hair for years, but I am hopeless when it comes to curling irons so when I stumbled across the Babyliss version of this product I was instantly intrigued and began reading about it and watching youtube video demonstrations. I was randomly walking through Belks and saw the Infiniti Pro by Conair Curl Secret on their clearance table (by accident, but I argued and they honored the $47 price) so I picked it up. I have been so happy I did.<br /><br />I have now had the product about a month, and I have had no troubles with it. I assume people who are getting their hair stuck are not reading the instructions that clearly state to section your hair into 1/2 inch sections and hold the product with a specific side towards your head. By accident I have put too much hair in and it beeps at me, informing me that it won't accept the allotted hair. The whole process takes me about 15 min, the same time I would spend with a flat iron, ironing in sections, and the curl holds for me about 3 days, when I am due for my next wash. My hair holds a style very well, so I assume it could go longer if I dared.<br /><br />The only reason I am deducting a star is because the curls only go in one direction. Some of the more elite versions of this product have choice of curl directions and alternating directions, which I would like. I also notice some frizz which I could probably tame if I knew how without destroying the curl.
  699. I have never seen , as esay to use hair curler as this one before, i was never able to curle hair by myself. Now I can seriously say that this one is one of must haves for women, you may not have as perfect hairstyle as you can get from proffesional but you can have everyday beautiful natural looking curles. Curles don't last very long,but that's better that I used to have.

  719.   741. I'd like to start by saying don't be frightened away by the negative reviews you might read. I always search reviews of products before I make purchases, especially ones that have higher price tags. At first I was worried after reading peoples horror stories of needing to cut off their hair because it got stuck in this styler. I still really liked the concept of this styler and took a chance. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!! I couldn't use a curling iron to save my life. Even when I did manage a curl or two with a regular curling iron the curl would fall out within two hours.<br />As soon as I got my Curl Secret I couldn't wait to try it out. Like many of the positive reviews I reiterate &#34;read the instructions&#34;. Be sure to have the styler facing your head in the right direction, only use 1/2&#34; - 1&#34; sections of hair, and make sure your hair is tangle and product free. At first I struggled finding a comfortable way to hold the styler. It is a bit awkward until you get used to it. Put your section of hair in, squeeze, it twirls your hair in, wait for the beeps, release, and you come out with a truly amazing curl.<br />I'm not sure how any of the people who wrote negative reviews were using this styler to end up getting their hair stuck. If you try to put too much hair in the styler beeps and will not pull your hair in. Pretty simple there.<br />Aside from how easy this is to use I absolutely love how long the curls stay in. I curled my hair and after a ten hour work shift it was still as curly as right after I did it. Plus, the next day they relaxed a bit more and gave a softer look. I have done nothing but rant about this product any chance I get. Don't let those negative reviews scare you. Buy it!!

The Curl Secret works amazing, never tangles my hair (that is very fine, easy to tangle). And when it does (when it goes in the chamber wrong, or a little tangled) it immediately realeses my hair, before any damage happens.<br />The curl secret also has a more &#34;natural&#34; result, that I've never got with any other curler. With the culing wand you usually get a &#34;way too perfect curl&#34;, impossible to be natural. And if you use the Curl Secret in the &#34;8sec + low heat&#34; set up you get loose, natural curls. Kind of a Gisele Bunchen hair.
  774. Great product, great price! Shipped fast! Thanks Amazon!
  775. This is by far the best hair curler I've found to date!!! I've tried everything on earth to try and speed up the process of curling my hair from rollers, curling irons, etc. There are two setting depending on how tight the curl is you are looking for. It beeps a few times to let you know it's done in seconds. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. This is the first review I've written on a product, although before buying just about anything I always read the reviews. I'm so happy I figured it's well worth sharing that you will not regret the $99 spent. I even found a great sale at Christmas and bought 3 for friends and my mother. I can't wait to hear how happy they are too :) Way to go Conair!!!
  776. Great product love it
  777. I am not only &#34;lazy&#34; when it comes to taking the time to style my hair but I also have limited dexterity in my right side. I am always looking for a quick and easy way to give my hair some style. My hair is fine but I have a lot of it. It's pretty short; length is between my ears and shoulders and it's got a funky wave if left to air dry.<br /><br />The Conair Infiniti Pro Curl is the best tool I have found thus far and I have tried many. It is easy, quick and takes the frustration out of curling my short, fine locks - even in the back. The curls come out silky smooth, makes my hair look healthy, and -- I never thought I's ever say this -- but the curls last all day. Got to love that!<br /><br />I have not experienced any serious entanglements. I have had a few few stray hairs get a tug here and there but it is caused from improperly feeding my hair into the unit. If I am not paying enough attention and improperly feed a section into the Curl Secret, it stops immediately, reverses and prevents any serious damage or pain.<br /><br />It heats up quickly. I do not have to worry about burning my fingers or scalp. And since all I have to do with my other hand is hold a section of hair, my weaker side does not tire nor do I experience the frustration of the inability to handle, twist, turn, clip or whatever with my other hand.<br /><br />I rarely submit reviews but I had to share my thoughts given past experience with other products. This will not disappoint, especially if you struggle with any physical impairments. Highly recommended.

  780. Absolutely LOVE this thing! I have recently let my hair grow out and I can flat iron and straighten it like a pro but when it comes to curling it, I'm clueless!! This thing is definitely idiot proof. I tried the first time on dirty hair and did 3 sections making bigger curls and last night, I curled it on clean hair and used 4 sections making more, smaller curls. Everyone is amazed. This is super easy to use. As for getting hair caught in it, it happend a few times but it immediately beeps to let you know so I just slowly slid it down to release the curls. It was because the sections of hair I grabbed were too big. I purchased mine at Target (to make for an easy return) because I was SO sure I would be returning it but it's a keeper!

  785. So cool and works awesome
  786. Wow, this product is awesome. I have naturally wavy hair, but it was never wavy enough to go without curling my hair into some sort of style. A regular curling iron flattens my natural waves. This curling magic wand gives me natural curls that make me look like I have a spiral perm. It is soooooo easy to use! I have a LOT of hair, and it is colored/bleached/fragile, so I have to be careful with each little section that I place in the iron. I don't like it if my hair gets ratted and stuck in the machine, so I comb each section first. The other trick I learned is do not try to control the hair that is swirling up into the iron. It you put any pressure on the hair, it does not feed into the drum correctly. So just comb the little section, loosely hold it out, and let go when it starts feeding into the drum. Highly recommend this product!

  794. I have been waiting nearly 6 months to write this review, I wanted to make sure I knew everything about this product first! PROS: this thing works awesome on my naturally curly (frizzy curls) hair. I normally straight iron but the curl secret curls my hair and takes away the frizz. I highly recommend watching youtube videos prior to using the curler. Different settings will give you different types of curls, you need to spend some time playing around with the options. It took me a week to find the &#34;perfect&#34; setting. My favorite thing about this product is how I don't burn my fingers or ears like I always did with a traditional curling iron! It takes me 20 minutes to curl my whole head of long thick hair-not bad!<br /><br />CONS: your hair will get snagged in this thing at some point and it does hurt a bit. DON'T panic! I have been able to successfully release my hair without burning it off everytime. Use smaller sections of brushed out hair. The only other complaint is that it's difficult to do the back of my head, I have to bring the sections to the sides where I can see in the mirror and for the life of me I can't figure out how to use it with my left hand :/<br /><br />Overall worth the price fir someone who can't use a traditional curling iron.

Like I said though its easy to correct if you pay attention to what your doing.<br /><br />As for my curls... I have a lot of hair but its somewhat fine hair... my hair is pretty smooth, naturally wavy. normal curlers cant hold my hair but with this miracle they are the best I've seen.   872. If I could rate it a zero I would.   873. I am really happy with this product. It's a little bit heavy to hold but you get an entire head of curls so quickly that overall it's no problem. I get compliments every time I use it and I love that I don't have to use hairspray.
  874. This product is outstanding. Curls last more than a day for me. It's easy to use and does what it says it will do. I use it on tight setting (12 seconds, Hi temperature).
  875. I saw the Conair Curl Secret on a home shopping show and decided to give it a try. I have long, fine, straight, dark hair. To get volume, it is cut into long layers. As a very busy mom, I don't have a whole lot of time to fool around with my hair. I will occasionally use an Instyler and a hot brush/dryer. Those work relatively well but I was intrigued by the curls that this product could create.<br /><br />I gave it a try and used the Curl Secret on the lowest settings. It created perfect corkscrew curls all over my head. Not good. I looked like a Latina Little Bo Peep and if I were on a elementary school dance team, that would have been perfect. I brushed those curls out and I had major volume. Terrific, magazine-type volume. Minutes later, my hair separated into perfect Little Bo Peep corkscrew curls again. For the first time in my life, my hair held a curl but I didn't want it! I had places to go, so it was like Groundhog Day, brush-volume then perfect Bo Peep curls sprang back. And on a rainy day, no less.<br /><br />The next day - exactly the same thing. Look ladies, I have a pretty good sense of humor so I figured that this thing really does work and I would try a different technique the next time I use it. The third day, I washed my hair and curled the bottom sections of my long hair and held it only for three beeps instead of the four (it beeps to let you know that your hair is ready). Perfection. The curls are large and loose (similar to Kate Middleton). I have nice volume with hair that looks like a woman. I couldn't be happier.<br /><br />Yes, the thing can snag your hair. Read the instructions carefully and only use small sections. I like the product and plan on keeping it.

The other reviewers are correct when they state that you also must re-comb each strand before allowing it to go into the roller, even after you've brushed your hair several times. If you have thick hair like me, this process is time consuming and grueling, but I'm not going to fault the curling iron simply because I'm lazy.   890. To all those who are saying it doesn't work, etc... make sure you are doing it properly. I messed it up the first time I used it and was convinced it wouldn't curl my long hair -but then I realized I was doing it wrong.<br /><br />-I didn't realize it had to beep 5 times. I was releasing on the first beep and nothing was really curling. Make sure you hold it til you hear the multiple beeps in a row.<br />-Take small sections in to avoid hair getting stuck. As long as the hair is a small enough section, theres no reason it should get stuck. I am practicing with this because it did get stuck once or twice and I had to pull it out. That's really the only reason why I gave it 4 stars.<br /><br />Love it!

I've not had a tangle problem, however when I've tried to curl too much hair it will stop pulling the hair in and I just load it again with less hair.   957. I read so many of the reviews that made it sound like my hair would be sucked up and claimed by this curler. I had visions of having to cut off my hair at the root to release it. I still decided to take a chance on it. I have long hair that is difficult to curl and doesn't hold curl very well, especially in humid weather. I can curl my hair when getting dressed, and by the time I get downstairs, it's straight again.<br /><br />Because of the past difficulty in curling my hair, I used the highest setting at the longest time. First of all, it beeped and flashed if I put too much hair in it. As a first-time user, it didn't get my hair stuck in it at all. When it beeped and flashed there was a problem, I released it and my hair came out without a problem. After the first use, I think I need to turn down the settings. It definitely made a lot of curl, and the curl didn't fall out even after brushing. There was too much curl and fluffiness for my liking. The next day after sleeping on it, I still had enough wave in my hair that I didn't have to curl it.<br /><br />I still have some learning to do as to how to use this curler, but I think it will work for me. It's just a matter of experimenting with the amount of curl I want and how close to my head that I want it. Since I wash my hair every other day, I am impressed that the curl lasts for the second day. To- date, I haven't had any other curling method that would last even one day.<br /><br />UPDATE:<br />I have now used this curler about 4 times, and have gotten better with it. So far, I haven't had my hair get stuck in it even once. The trick is to keep strand of hair to 1-2 inches at the widest point, and to make sure it all fits in the channel of the curler. The first time I used the curler, I had it set to the high heat setting with the longest curl setting because my hair is usually difficult to curl and doesn't hold curl. I also started the curl within 3 inches of my head. Doing it this way, the style was much too \\"bushy\\" for my liking. The second time, I used the low heat setting with the longest curl cycle, and started the curl 4-5 inches from my head. I also held the curler closed for a few seconds past the 3 beeps for done. Doing it this way, the style was great - not bushy, but perfect curls. Using other curling methods, my hair was usually straight the next day after sleeping on it. After using this curler, there was still a lot of body and plenty of waves when I brushed it out. I didn't have to curl it again or pull it back like I have done in the past.<br /><br />At this point, I would highly recommend this curler for anyone with long, hard to curl hair. Follow the directions that come with the curler, and you won't have any problems with it.\\"bushy\\" for my liking. The second time, I used the low heat setting with the longest curl cycle, and started the curl 4-5 inches from my head. I also held the curler closed for a few seconds past the 3 beeps for done. Doing it this way, the style was great - not bushy, but perfect curls. Using other curling methods, my hair was usually straight the next day after sleeping on it. After using this curler, there was still a lot of body and plenty of waves when I brushed it out. I didn't have to curl it again or pull it back like I have done in the past.<br /><br />At this point, I would highly recommend this curler for anyone with long, hard to curl hair. Follow the directions that come with the curler, and you won't have any problems with it.

  965. I have straight, straight, straight hair that is also quite fine.. Everyone at work complimented me on my wavy hair - a first!<br /><br />I didn't find it that difficult to use... I watched a YouTube video, read the instructions carefully, and then gave it a try. You really have to work on very SMALL sections of hair - I didn't have any problems with it being caught in the machine. Also, unclamp the handles and let the curl just &#34;drop&#34; out of the machine and let it cool...don't try to pull it out or stretch it. Afterwards, finger-comb, spray and voila! This machine is a miracle to me - the first time I have finally had the kind of hair I always wanted!

It looks a little intimidating, but it beeps and releases before your hair gets stuck and was very easy to use with a quick read of the instructions.

I was worried about my hair getting tangled inside but if your hair begins to tangle, the product stops pulling the hair in and once you open it, the hair comes right out. This is much easier to use than a regular curling iron.

No hairspray required and curl will last at least three days with minimal maintenance (just re-comb with fingers as needed.) I have long thick hair which requires me to curl about 30-40 strands.   983. I got this as a gift on my birthday November 26, 2013. I didn't actually use this product until November 23, 2014 - I was THAT intimidated by this product. Almost an entire year went by before I could summon the courage to use this.<br /><br />Verdict: It's pretty amazing.<br /><br />It says that you have to use clean hair in it and I didn't. I used this on second day hair and it worked amazing. You definitely want to use small sections of hair for this as well. I have very thick and frizzy hair, so this took me quite a while to do a full head of curls, but the outcome was pretty fantastic.<br /><br />Tips: Whatever setting you use, when it does its final set of beeps, open the device and then pull the device down. You get perfect ringlet curls every time. Don't open the device while simultaneously pulling down. The curls come out wonky.<br /><br />If you use too much and your hair gets stuck, just open it up and it releases your hair.<br /><br />Lock it in with some hairspray and you're good to go.
  984. Really Works, Love this. My hair was is shoulder length little shorter brushed it well used small sections. No tangles, great curls lasted through a night sleep. This is the only product I have ever used, that worked and did it well. Worth every penny.

  986. My hair is incredibly stubborn and hates to hold a curl. The Curl Secret is a miracle for my hair! I use the high heat setting for 12 seconds, and my thick, heavy hair will hold a curl for 3 days with no products other than a little bit of hairspray. The only time it ever tangles is if I get a bit too much hair in a section, or the hair is wildly different lengths due to layers. Make sure that your hair is tangle free, and that you take small sections, and it should work well for you. I absolutely LOVE IT.

  989. I got it on time. It Works well. Very good
  990. This lets me produce gorgeous bouncy, smooth hair from very thick, coarse, wavy/frizzy long hair. There is a learning curve - the machine must be the right way around and hair must be tangle free. If you have layers, twist the sections with different length layers before inserting the hair into the groove, and then untwist it once the hair is deep in the groove - this prevents tangling and warning beeps. If you try to insert too much hair at once, it won't wind up. MOST IMPORTANT: If the warning beeps sound, STOP at once and completely release the hair. If you just release the pressure on the handle and then repress it without releasing the hair, it will roll up further and get horribly snarled in the chamber. If this does happens - turn off the heat at once before starting the get the hair out - it may take a while and you want to do everything to reduce your hair burning. Once you master the technique, it works perfectly. Every time. I have very thick, coarse, long wavy hair and masses of hairs - about 6 times as many as a normal person, my hairdresser says. Think 1.5 inch diameter ponytail. It takes me 50 minutes to straighten my hair to an acceptable level with irons or three batches of Big Curl hot rollers to curl it (and then the ends don't curl because there is too much hair). Too. Much. Hair. I had given up. Then I found this! LOVE Curl Secret because it doesn't have just 12 rollers, or let me try to curl too much hair at once. It makes sure that only a reasonable amount of hair is being curled at a time, so every curl is prefect, and I can just keep going until all my hair is curled. No more waiting for rollers to cool in my hair before reheating them for the next batch. And no more failed curling attempts with a heated tong, because I got impatient and started trying to curl way too much hair at once just to get it finished. It takes me about 50 minutes to curl all of my hair, but I do it in batches. I take a break whenever I want/need to. I use thelowest setting, let it cool completely and then brush it well with a brush and I am left with gorgeous loose, bouncy SMOOTH big waves. Very Hollywood old style. It lasts until my next head wash (3-4 days). If i just brush the top and finger brush the rest, my hair stays in more ringlet type curls which I don't prefer but which suit my daughter well. I really really love it. I took one star off because it is not easy to get the hang of - it takes some persistence to get the technique right and I did have two serious hair-stuck-in-the-machine-and-burning snarls before I worked out how to avoid this. If I had less hair, the sections of hair I cut away would probably be upsetting! As it is, you'd never notice it in my hair so no worries there for me. I am converted! If you have unruly, wild hair - give this a try and watch it tame your hair into beautiful bouncy waves.
  991. I love it! Curling my whole head of hair in 1/2 hour is amazing. I have stick straight hair which normally won't keep a curl unless I spray my hair to death with hairspray but these curls stay intact about 85% with just a light spray of hairspray. I LOVE that it beeps to let me know when it's done, I don't even have to think about what I'm doing. It's a little top heavy which I had to get used to but it's easy to use and figure out.

  999. We got this for my daughters (one has pin straight hair and the other has a natural wave) as a Christmas present and now that we have used it several times I wanted to leave my review....<br /><br />The unit was fast to heat up and fairly easy for me to use on my daughters but I don't see them being able to do it themselves. The device has to held a certain way in order to allow the hair to be pulled in properly and you have to make sure you aren't trying to curl too much hair at one time. I like the built in timer and different heat settings it offers.<br /><br />For my daughter with the natural wave/curl to her hair, the Curl Secret worked great and I didn't use any styling products either!! I curled her hair in the morning and when she got home from school her curls were still in great condition....they even looked good the next morning after sleeping on them.<br /><br />My daughter with the pin straight hair is a different story....We had used other curling wands and irons that didn't create the pretty curls she was looking for but the Curl secret did! However, her curls didn't last the entire day as she had hoped but I do not think this is the device's fault. My daughter's hair just wants to be straight! To get her curls to last an entire school day, I have to use the Curl Secret on the highest setting with the timer set to the longest time (plus I tend to leave the hair in for an extra couple of seconds)...plus, we had to use several styling products including a bunch of hair spray with made her curls seem a little &#34;stiff&#34; instead of bouncy.<br /><br />In all, I liked the device and if I had long hair still I'd be using it on myself!

  1005. I have super straight hair that never stays curled. I bought this curler as a gift for my daughter who also has tough hair to curl. Unlike myself, she has no curling iron experience.   1006. I have NEVER, I repeat, NEVER been able to get a curl in my hair. I got a perm when I was a kid and the ish fell out! Anyways, I bought this at Target just in case I needed a QUICK AND EASY return (smell what I'm stepping in, Amazon?), and I have to say I am amazed. I read the directions thoroughly, because let's face it - this thing looks a little terrifying and conjures memories of getting my hair wrapped up in a spiral brush as a kid. Small brushed pieces, 1-inch, face towards the head, yadda yadda, some beeping, stay calm...VIOLA - magic curls. I actually plugged this beautiful baby in at my desk at work, and used a pocket mirror to test it out, I couldn't stand the wait! I also tested a piece of my boss' hair for good measure. She is purchasing one tomorrow.<br /><br />Some thoughts:<br />1- Don't panic when it keeps winding after all your hair is sucked in. It's just a formality. Stay calm and wait for the beeps.<br />2- Don't panic when your hair goes in and gets caught. Notice I said when, not if. This IS going to happen. It's part of the dance, go with it, release the handle and gently untangle. Try again.<br />3- The timer is a guideline, test the waters, and hold longer if need be. The curler doesn't release until you let the handle go.<br />4- MY GOD FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS. Ladies (and Gents, no discrimination here. Let them long locks flow and curl fellas), if you're near-bout to cut off a lock of hair because you got her twisted in there so deep Channel 11 news is runnin a special on you...you're doing it wrong. Really wrong. This thing is idiot-proof, trust me. I'm an idiot, card-carrying member since '78.<br /><br />I would 100% recommend this to a friend!

  1017. As soon as it arrived we took it out of the box and used it on my daughter's hair.   1018. I like this product because it puts a different type of curl in my hair than my regular irons do. I have very long, medium thick, fine hair. First, if your hair gets stuck, open and close the curler until it lets it go. No need to pull hair out. Second, if you twist the strand that you are going to curl at the top, it will eliminate random hairs getting in and tangling it all up. I only gave this product a 4 because, although I love the type of curls, they do not say very long. This is a problem when it take 3 times longer to do my hair this way.   1022. This thing works like the commercials. The best part is that somehow the curls last all day vs. traditional curling iron. I have straight Asian hair and usually by the end of the day, you can't tell I curled anything but with Curl Secret, it looks almost as strong as it did in the morning. However there are many negatives for a beginner. It is ultra sensitive in how you put the hair in it. You cannot take a huge or even a large chunk of hair or it gets tangled and it is like heck to get out. You must have very smooth hair to work well. Anyone with dry, kinky hair, I cannot imagine would do well for the same reason. As you notice the commercials and even the youtube vids show ppl with healthy smooth hair. It is also hard to do the back of your head on your own. It is somewhat heavy to be holding. Not a time saver. I find I only use it if I know I have at least 30 mins free. I use my iron for the few wispy curls around my face. The Curl secret is too strong for that so no doing it halfway and taking off. I have had it for 6 month and only used it twice and I curl my long hair at least 3 times a week. I love the result but it is daunting to use and takes forever doing one inch at a time. Instead I use it for special occasions. Ironically I still recommend this product, just not for the inexperienced.

  1049. I didnt buy the Curl secret from Amazon.. I bought from Khols.. with Khols cash and other coupons, so I didnt pay but $40 bucks for it.. I almost didnt buy it, because of the terrible reviews about the hair getting tangled, either having to be cut our machine disassembled to remove the hair.. Ok first off.. Either I have a newer model or others did not use it correctly by reading the directions first.. The machine has a built in damage control.. If your hair starts to tangle the machine automatically beeps and stops.. Releasing the handle the hair releases.. Second.. You can feel it start to tangle so just release the lever and it stops.. Not sure how one could tangle their hair so badly.. follow the directions it wont happen.. Third...You have to use smaller portions of your hair than you would a regular curling iron..So may take you just a bit longer than a regular iron.. But let me say..the curls are amazing.. Long spiral curls.. it has adjustment numbers for tighter curls or looser.. I get compliments on my hair all the time.. It is a great iron.. 6 other curling irons I have.. none of which come close to the curls this one gives... I highly recommend.. just be smart and read the directions first on how to use it.. It is at first a little awkward..but you get the hang of it pretty quickly.. If done properly you will not get tangled..

  1067. I was not a believer until my mom ordered this. It's now mine!! I have very long, fine, smooth hair that looks nice curled...for the 5 minutes the curl usually lasts. I used this (yes it takes some getting used to) and my hair took to it instantly. It took about 30 minutes total and lasted the entire day! I was in and out of doors in warm weather and my hair looked great. My boyfriend said it was his favorite look, called it my wild hair! It's not messy but looks professionally done and voluminous, not ringlets. I even tried just doing a few accent pieces instead of my whole head, when I was in a hurry, and it still looked great and held. I didn't even use much hairspray or any other products. Some reviewers complained about hair getting stuck. Admittedly my hair is smooth so that may help but it only got stuck twice and if you just open the tool completely it usually falls out easily or with only a gentle tug. It's no different than an old school bristled curling iron in that respect. If you have trouble with your hair holding curl or want a more modern and professional looking curl, this tool is definitely worth the cost...and this is coming from a major cheapskate!

  1077. I was afraid to try this because of the comments people have made about their hair getting stuck in this device. I purchased it and waited for several days before finally giving it a try. Wow. I've used it several times with fantastic results and have yet to get my hair tangled in this thing. If you brush out your hair before inserting it into the &#34;chamber&#34; you shouldn't have any problem. All you have to do is wait for the beeps to let you know when it is finished curling your hair.<br /><br />I used small amounts of hair each time I curled it... probably around 1/2 inch. I think the less hair you feed into it, the better the results. If a section wasn't curled as much as I wanted, I'd let it cool and go back and feed it through again. It came out perfectly. Once finished and combed through (finger combing), you get amazing curls that last! This does work best on freshly washed/dried hair. I also cut back on my conditioner so that it's not weighed down. My hair type is straight, medium thickness and generally does not hold curl at all. Seriously. I've had great results with this... Don't be afraid to give this a try!

  1081. Are you sick & tired of hearing the overused term \\"AMAZING\\", just like I am? Well get ready to hear it again because this little gem of a product is exactly that... A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! I stumbled across this product while leafing through a Bed, Bath & Beyond catalog. A product that could actually produce curls in my straight, lifeless hair? Yeah, right. I decided to check out the reviews and couldn't believe the rave reviews this product was getting. THAT DAY after work I went out and purchased one (didn't want to wait for it to be shipped). People are right when they say it's idiot-proof! It's SO easy to use! If you're like me and don't like spending time reading through instructions, just make sure you hold it properly and put the part that says \\"This side faces head\\" towards your head before putting your hair in. Use small stands of hair (about 1/2 thick). If you try to load too thick a strand, it will beep 3 times right off the bat to let you know it's overloaded. Choose your heat setting and how tight a curl you want and get ready to be wowed! It's been two hours since I curled my hair and I'm sitting here at work sitting pretty with LOTS of curls! For what it cost, this product is well worth what I spent since it actually does what it claims. No more fumbling around with hot rollers ever again! Thank you, Conair!

  1125. I was captivated by this product on the commercials. I mean, how could you not be, right? And while normally I wouldn't spent $100 on a curling iron because it looked cool on a commercial, this was an exception. The idea is amazing. I had been burning myself with my curling wand all the time and the curls were coming out sloppy and loose anyway. To be fair, the Curl Secret takes a little bit of practice. I always used to curl my hair as a solution to second-day hair, and the Curl Secret works much better with freshly washed/dried hair. Your hair definitely has to be straight/non-tangled so I'd recommend brushing it right before putting it in the curl-chamber. The biggest thing that helped me is trying to curl SMALL pieces. That seems totally obvious, but really, the smaller you make the curls, the better they come out and the better they stay. For me, the 12-second timer on high with small pieces makes perfect ringlets. I love that there's no more flinging around my curling wand trying to wrap my long hair around it. There's also no more guessing how long you've been sitting there waiting for it to curl (so no burning your hair off like in that viral Youtube video). I also love that you can put the curl chamber right up to the side of your head, so you don't have curls starting awkwardly a few inches down your hair. And it's seriously IMPOSSIBLE to burn yourself. I thought that the Curl Secret would be a great way to make curls quickly and easily. Honestly, it doesn't make really fast curls out of second-day hair like I originally wanted. But Curl Secret makes AMAZING curls easily and they stay without buckets of hair spray. They look great, they stay great, and they're easy to do. I'm obsessed.

This here invention is greater than sliced bread. It's even better than chunky peanut butter. Heck, I'll go as far as to say it's better than Reese's peanut butter cups (which for me is saying a lot). I read every review. I searched YouTube for demo videos. I figured if I was going to plunk out another $100 for something that wasn't going to work with my hard to curl hair type, I was at least going to know what I was getting into. I have very long, very fine and extremely hard to hold a curl hair. But this handy dandy tool has changed all that. As long as you follow the instructions, you will not be dis-satisfied. I will stick with my hot curlers as these are much easier to use. If they can manage to make a more user friendly lighter unit this would rock, but until then, if you purchase this, prepare for a killer arm workout. also have to mention you have to face this unit with one side always to your head (labeled on unit which side) which can be difficult when curling the back of your head.   1165. To be completely HONEST, I couldn't give this 5 stars because of a major hair catastrophe. I'm now on my 2nd curl secret, but cannot blame anyone but myself.<br />I first purchased the curl secret so I could do my own hair for my bridal photos. I excitedly, and hurriedly, read the instructions on how to use the product and began right away.<br />See, the Curl Secret has this fancy &#34;beep&#34; indicator that basically tells you &#34;Hey idiot! You've got too much hair in there - take it out!!!&#34; What happens when you choose not to is your hair gets tangled. IN THE MACHINE. And let me tell you this ... it gets tangled to the point where it takes one person to hold it, and the other person to go at it with a screwdriver. Thus began the breakdown of Curl Secret #1.<br />Luckily my hair is not over processed, and despite 15 minutes in a tangled machine, my hair survived. But, I can only blame myself. I urge you - DON'T try to stuff too much hair in the machine. If the machine tells you it's too much, it's too much!<br />That being said, I was happy enough with the product, despite the obvious user error, I bought a second one.<br />It is FANTASTIC.<br />I have very long, fine hair and I've never been able to hold a curl .... until the Curl Secret. I can have loose waves or tight curls, and they legitimately last all day.<br />I would buy another Curl Secret in a heartbeat .... but hopefully I don't have to because of another &#34;user error.&#34; If this issue could be eliminated, I'd gladly give it 5 stars.

  1204. I've had the curl secret for over a year. While it does an excellent job of achieving a certain type of curl, it doesn't necessarily replace a curling iron.<br /><br />PRO<br />-achieves a consist curl on both sides or your head<br />-easy to use once you get the hang of it (great for anyone who struggles with using an iron)<br />-the absolute best part of the this iron is that hair is heated on BOTH sides so curls LAST LONG! Sometimes days with minor touch ups!<br />-multiple heat settings allows a variety of curl coil (tight or loose)<br />-Perfect for above the shoulder length hair.<br /><br />CON<br />-really only makes one type of curl, either loose of tight depending on how long you hold it (vs. an iron where you can alternate direction, thickness etc)<br />-takes waaaay longer than an iron because you can only curl VERY small sections of hair at a time<br />-HEAVY! If you have a lot of hair be prepared for an arm workout!<br />-tangles hair. No matter how many times I have curled my hair over the year, I ALWAYS tangle (at least one piece of) my hair. Its probably because I'm frustrated by how long it takes so I take sections that are too wide into the machine.<br />-tangles (getting hair stuck in machine) hurts a lot! Its one of those OW!!! \\"Get this thing off my hair!\\" moments. Its a mad rush to reverse and unplug before permanent damage happens.<br />-the longer the hair, the more likely it tangles<br />-price. You can get the same look with a curling iron for much less money<br /><br />Overall I would recommend the curl secret for anyone with above the shoulder length hair and/or anyone who has trouble using a curling iron.<br /><br />*see my curl secret photo for long hair in customer images

  1234. Nice product and shipping!
  1235. The process required to curl hair is not what you see on the commercials. The commercial implies that the hair curls as it is pulled through the device. Not so, each section of hair you curl has to be held inside the device for 8 to 12 seconds (depending on how tight of a curl you want. Thus, it takes a long time to curl a full head of hair. While it did a nice job with the curl, it did jam on me a few times - which also slowed things down. It can be fussy regarding orientation. If it isn't held exactly perpendicular then jamming is possible. For the money, I am not sure it is worth it for someone like me with thick hair. A traditional curling iron (which cost a lot less) takes about the same amount of time with less &#34;mechanical&#34; issues.
  1236. Love this product. Easy to use and yes you hair does get stuck now and then but don't panic it's easy to get out. Curls stay the whole night.

  1244. I have super straight Asian hair and have had trouble keeping a curl for longer than 10minutes, haha. I bought this to try it out, and I'm super happy with how easy it is to use. My hair is down to a little above my shoulders (I have fine hair, and a LOT of it), and even though the back hair is only a few inches long, it can still create a nice wavy look to match the longer curls in the front and sides. It gives me that pin-up model style and I love it. My hair HAS gotten trapped a few times, usually I can get it out within the minute but it can and will damage your hair, so make sure you follow the pictures on how to position the curler, and don't overload it with hair (small sections of a time only). It takes me about 20-30 minutes to completely curl all my hair, and that's me being semi-cautious but also semi-impatient. Use hair clips to section off hair and start with the under hairs first.
  1245. doesn't do as well as advertised
  1246. Purchased this on a recent trip to Canada as it was much cheaper than the Babyliss version available in Europe, and I didn't want to splash out on that without knowing it worked.<br />Have now used this twice and have been impressed with the results. I have VERY thick hair, shoulder length, and usually use a curling iron, also bought from N.America. I would say this gives a looser curl than the iron, as with the iron you can heat the hair for longer if you wish. I also found it a little tricky to do the right side of my head, remembering to keep the correct side of the curler close to the head, and did get an achy arm after a while - but that's the same for the iron.<br />I like the pro curler as it is generally easier to use than the curling iron and, for me, the curls held a long time. I used it first the day before catching a long overnight flight and my hair still looked good after arriving and then after a cat nap! It seems to prefer width to depth, i.e. divide hair into layers which do not go too far down the head. I found this could be avoided by not starting too close to the scalp. Also no burnt fingers with the pro curler!<br />I will keep my circling iron as it does wonderfully tight curls, with staying power, but for ease of use, will use this first I think. Hope that helps someone!
  1247. Great product. Easy to use. Avoid using big sections of hair to prevent tangling. Good seller, good overall experience.
  1248. This is by far the easiest tool I have ever used on my hair! I watched the ads for a while before ordering one...waiting...thinking...no way could it be that easy. HA! It really is! I was shocked at the simplicity of this tool. I am really all thumbs when it comes to styling my hair...really bad at it....but this just made me go from eh stylist...to WOW! Follow the directions the first time...and make sure to comb through each section before you put it in the tool and your hair will come out perfectly. Love, love, love this tool!

  1250. I love this curler! I have very thick, dry,fuzzy shoulder length hair. I tried all the settings and the best for me is the highest, which is 5 beeps. I wash it every other day to keep it from getting too dry. I also have layered hair. I find the curls look exactly like the infomercial, spiral and soft. It's a curl I have not been able to get with a regular curling iron. On the top layers of my hair I do smaller pieces. But I get that beachy wave look I wanted. On the second day, it is not as curly, but still has tons of volume and I can fluff it with my fingers after brushing to get it just right. If I try to get too much hair in it stops itself, but there is no tugging or pain. Once or twice I've had a few years get pulled on, or snagged, but no more than I would have with a regular barrel iron. It DOES take 20-25 minutes to do my hair but that's fine. I just do some side steps so I can get my fitbit steps in for the day. Exercise and good looking hair. WIN-WIN!

  1313. First thing first: I leave feedbacks very rare. This tool really deserves it. In a humid climate we still want to be beautiful. I find it difficult to do curls in a humid climate because by the time when you reach the last curl you feel exhausted and sweating. I prefer to straighten my hair but not with this tool. This tool made me look like a super model. The hair became so gorgeous that I want to go out right now and show it out. But I will do it tomorrow cause I am 100% sure that the curls will last by tomorrow.<br />Actually, you can make several styles with this curls not only 3 styles which are described by Conair: tight, medium and light curls. If you start at the middle of your head, you can get natural waves, like if you would be using a regular hair straightener. These curls are amazing!<br />What about the negative feedbacks about tangling your hair? It does tangle the hair, I cannot deny it. BUT, IT DOES ONLY FOR THOSE LAZY PEOPLE(NO OFFENCE BUT YES, LAZY PEOPLE) who do not bother to follow the instructions as they are written. This is a machine. You do not drive a car when you are drunk or impaired for any other reason. Unless the car is driving by itself. What will happen if you drive the car being impaired? It will crash, right?<br />What will happen if you put a wrinkled dollar into ATM machine? It will be returned to you... Right!<br />Same here! The piece of hair must be no more than inch and correctly inserted inside. Remove all the fluffy hair around. What I mean by fluffy is that because this is just an engineered machine, it recognizes only straight and brushed hair inside as the correct one. All other fluffy hair, which will come on the way will be tangled and sometimes it is painful. I got that twice but I know it is my fault. I wanted to experiment and see what will happen if I do it wrong way.<br />Anyway, do not be lazy, if you want your hair to look gorgeous and last for two days, take a piece of hair no thicker than 1 inch and brush it well. Oh, well, it probably will take longer with brushing... But the results will be there.<br />Why do I give it four stars for this tool?<br />It must have a pouch, which will keep this tool inside and protect from falls. The door of the tool, which is on the top looks very delicate to me and hope it does not break. I am sure it will break when it falls down. So in order for me to prevent that, I will the tool with its head first inside the sock. It holds it tight. I think you should do the same when you are finished. I know it does sound ridiculous but at least until they manufacture a pouch for this tool.<br />But it and enjoy it!ell. Oh, well, it probably will take longer with brushing...
